 | One of the most difficult boss battlers I've ever played. The game is very punishing if you aren't precise with your positioning, attacks, and dodges. 

The animations are smooth and the game feels quick and responsive. That said spamming attacks will animation lock you and the bosses will punish it. The boss fights feel varied and unique. Deaths seem expected, so jumping back into the fray is quick with little to no load times dropping you back into the action almost instantly.

Attacks have a light/charged version, where charging attacks give a brief window of lifesteal on attacks. Managing the window of lifesteal and when to dodge/tank attacks is critical to surviving each encounter. 
There are three main skill trees with the ability to choose one at a time. Unfortunately, there are no ways to gain skill points aside from killing the bosses, leaving little choice to upgrade aside from git gud. 

It's not a game I would recommend for the average player, but for those who are willing to challenge themselves and force their way through a brick wall should find it rewarding.

A very well-written game. I hope anyone that enjoys stories where you get to make some tough decisions gives this game a try. The game has the same vibe as a TellTale game, but with the difference being there is a clear GOOD and BAD ending to this game. 

Checklist:

Music: Really good. BGM is easy to listen to, and the welsh/celtic rock song for the credits and main menu is very fun to listen to. 

Character design: Pretty good for pixels. I could tell the difference between almost every npc, and the character splash art at the end of the end felt very modern. 

Aesthetic: I really enjoy the style. It's very clean pixel art. It's not common to see games in this style so it was a refreshing take on art and game design. 

Accessibility: You need to be someone who enjoys reading a lot of text, as a large majority of the game is comprised of reading character dialogue. There is no voice overs, just some mumbled gibberish. 

Game difficulty: Pretty easy. The first few weeks seem like there are some tough choices, but you learn pretty quick to listen to the petitioner speaking to your King character about their plight and needs. Depending on how they sound when they ask for help, you can tell right away if you should actually give them aid, or call them out on their bull crap. 

Multiple playthroughs: Kinda. This game is only best played by doing two routes. Good route, or bad route. There isn't multiple endings aside from doing things the ethically right way, or the morally corrupt way. 

Price Point: I was gifted the game, so I don't know how expensive it is in the store. But if it's anything under $25 USD, then it's a pretty fair price point. I would still recommend buying it at a sale price though, for the sole fact that the game is REALLY short. You'll do an entire play through in about 6 hours. Maybe less if you're not too worried about your choices and the impact of your choices. 

Cons:
There's only one thing that really bugged me during the entire game. There is a pretty clear situation that pops up pretty early on that you (the player) probably would never agree to do. However, the situation is written into the story and isn't actually a choice the player can make. Long story short, I didn't enjoy being locked out of a choice that I would never have made myself, but unfortunately, it's just part of the story. One of those times where what the player expects from a Kingdom Management Sim RPG and what the narrator (or game dev) intended don't really align. I don't see the game devs as bad people for this forced choice, but at the end of the day, I still I wish I could've completely avoided the literal main plot of the game. 

Overall: The game is great. Definitely consider picking it up if you like a gripping story. It's a bit TOO short, so it might be a good idea to pick it up when it goes on sale. | Um excelente jogo de pixel art onde você irá perceber que nem sempre ser um rei é fácil, ter que lidar problemas do reino, todo o jogo político para conseguir vantagens com seus aliados que buscam também favores para sim, e também o apelo emocional que ele faz você se conectar com os personagens e sentir as perdas, mesmo sendo um jogo leve e com gráficos não avançados, em questão de narrativa, ele é sensacional, valeu cada centavo, um ótimo jogo | não compre, todos os arrependimentos que você tem por ter feito más escolhas na sua vida miserável não se compara ao que você vai sentir com esse jogo | Yes, Your Grace is a very well writen game where you act as a king, and with all the responsabilities coming with it. The game greets you with attaching characters and hilarious scenes, and unless you are an heartless jerk, it WILL make you high on feelium at some point.

This being said, the gameplay is simple and repetitive, not focused on action so it may not be for everyone as it's primarly a narrative game. As long as you enjoy text narratives and can take the time to appreciate pixel art, you are good to go.

It would add that this game have a good balance in its art style with pretty nice soundtracks and nice looking pixel art (which let room for imaginating the details). | O gerenciamento de recursos é relativamente fácil e simples, mas a história e a atmosfera do jogo é muito boa, as escolhas não interferem muito na progressão em si, mas você tem que decidir com base na sua régua moral e isso pra mim é o ponto mais divertido do jogo, vale muito a pena!

Вот так и хочется поставить нейтральный отзыв, которого для данного случая в стиме очень не хватает. 

Игра чем-то притягательным или захватывающим не выделяется, но и сильных и выдающихся минусов тоже не имеет. Запустить её на три-четыре вечера, собрать группу у костра, поварить суп из поганок и корешков, пройти 3 условно сюжетных сценария и при этом никак не напрячь своё серое вещество для каких-то сложных манипуляций (ну возможно кроме менеджмнта еды) - вот это вам сюда. Сидишь, тыкаешь на выживших, отправляешь их в вылазки, строишь/улучшаешь лагерь и слушаешь обрывки диалогов ночью, всё - весь геймплей. 
Вот единственное наверное для чего она идеально подойдёт - это отвлечься и отдохнуть от каких-то крупных произведений. Прошёл что-то большое, надо это переварить и подготовиться к следующей игре, или вообще пока нету времени/желания начинать что-то глобальное, вот тут она зайдёт хорошо.

Палец вверх, потому что ну не за что тут ставить отрицательный отзыв, как и не за что отдавать за неё полную цену, брать исключительно по скидке за 100 рублей. | -геймдизайн. одноразовый коротенький проходняк.
-сюжет. концепт переспективный, но просранный.
~графика. несколько картинок. | Отличная игра. | /

Absolutely beautiful art style that does not give away the punishing gameplay. In As Far As The Eye, you play as the wind, guiding a nomadic tribe to safe land. I very much enjoy the different take on the resource-management genre, with the journey broken up into multiple halts and obstacles. The short-term goal is simply to make it to the next halt before the step counter runs out and the flood arrives. The non-combative gameplay focuses on harvesting different resources instead, and actually provides a decent goal-oriented focus within which to use them.

Since each halt is procedurally generated, with varying amounts of ressources available, planning the journey ahead is essential for a realistic chance of making it to The Eye. Resources must be carefully managed, since they are simultaneously needed for the journey and the progression of the tribe per halt. At the beginning, I often struggled with rations and faced starvation among my Pupils. Only after many hours spent figuring out the mechanics, the gameplay finally started to feel fair. The challenge lies clearly in the fact that mistakes can’t be undone, with the single save file being overridden every turn.

Overall, I enjoy the simplicity of the gameplay, setting up camp over and over again, strategically placing buildings, and managing resources. The task-based progression of the tribe fosters a sense of attachment to the success of the Pupils. And I particularly love seeing them shapeshift into animal spirits based on their assigned trades. Although limited, the lore of As Far As The Eye fits seamlessly with the gameplay mechanics. This even makes me appreciate that excess resources gathered and left behind count against the final score, since the Pupils live in harmony with nature. | 6.5/10 - Decent

Buy on sale.  Worth the campaign and a run or two.  I can't remember how much I paid for it but about $10 CAD feels reasonable.

Really cute game.  Pretty decent challenge and strategy.  Satisfying to play once you learn.

Tip: 1. Start training a druid early.  2. If you can't find your pupils, look for their balloons.

If I had anything interesting to say, it would be that the bottlenecks between halts serve to really narrow my focus.  I'm not talking about the requirements to reach a halt, I'm talking about the inventory bottlenecks to reach it.  I found myself caring less and less about my pupils, their really cool skill trees, and what capabilities I could unlock, because I would likely need to throw away resources anyway to make room for food and the one mobile building I threw together.  It's really hard to get extraction up and running without a good supply of food for the beginning of each halt.  But the amount of food that requires takes up most of your caravan's inventory, making it hard to build anything right out of the gate.  
If I could change one small thing that would make the game significantly better, it would be to double the amount of food per stack in the caravan's inventory.  That would open up way more possibilities for interesting choices per run on what buildings to make mobile and what resources to take with you. | nicely done city builder in turn based | 氛围感拉满了

I really like it. The art style is amazing and I just love the animations for the giant beast. Some buildings take up more room then I feel they should and the way storage works is a little weird, but other then that the game is perfect. | Great game in Early Access. Lacks some polish and some quality of life features, but hopefully they'll come soon. | Love this game. Wish there where more like it. I just feel so bad for the critter I have my people on. I always try to be nice to it but eventually I  have to take its blood or pinch it because its stubborn. Save the onbu's!!! | Superbe jeu avec une vibe Nausicaa de Miyazaki, plusieurs niveaux de difficultés adaptés pour rejouer avec toujours plus de challenge. En temps que fan, à la fois des jeu chill et des jeux de gestion, je suis au anges avec ce jeu. Bravo à l'équipe de devs ! | C'est encore en développement mais déjà très abouti à l'heure où j'écris cet avis.

C'est un jeu de gestion original car au delà de la construction de la ville en soit assez classique il faut gérer l'animal géant sur lequel la ville est construite, et s'adapter aux changements de biotopes liés aux déplacements de cet animal géant. Et ça marche plutôt bien :-)
L'univers graphique est agréable, l'arbre de recherche est plutôt étoffé et donne envie de progresser.

J'espère qu'ils rajouteront des campagnes un peu plus globales car pour l'instant c'est du mode bac à sable uniquement et j'ai fini par me lasser (7h à l'heure de la critique, je reprendrai sûrement).

The best things about "Curse..." is that you can master it and has no BS mechanics that will kill you. If you died, it's on you. 

The worst thing is that it is bothersome. 

Somewhere in the middle of the game you will become spammed with spongy enemies. Full of HP with armors that are easy but time consuming to dispose. 

Moreover darkness mechanic is bothersome w/o adding any meaningful layer to the game. 

Also RNG is strong in this one. Which again - os bothersome considering that most of weapons is on "meh" or worse side.  Some goes for traits etc. 

So yeah, most of your runs you will end up with things that aren fun to use, takes time and you will start getting hurt because you tried to cut corners so you dont have to play it for so long... And this. This exactly what makes it thumbs down game. | A great little roguelite, deceivingly simple, incredibly addictive, and fairly challenging.

The combat system is pretty tight, easy to learn but challenging to master. I wish there were a few more weapons to add more variety, but there's already quite a few to choose from, depending on your playstyle and what you're comfortable with.

Admittedly, once you reach the hard mode things start getting a little too challenging fast, and there's no further upgrades to help you push through. You just need to "Git Gud". But if my only real criticism of the game is that its challenge mode is a little too challenging, I think it's pretty safe to say I would recommend it wholeheatedly. | Esse jogo é muito bom, porém tem alguns pontos que irritam bastante até você se acostumar, como o alcance dos golpes dos inimigos ou como o parry desse jogo é uma merda. | Имбушечка без изысков. Особо не понимаю зачем такая большая метапрогрессия рун, если самые удобные открываются в первые 50 минут игры. Некоторые эффекты проклятий раздражают в негативном смысле - вспышки перделки всякие заставляют щуриться, игра то тёмная. Атмосферка в игре тягомотная, всё однообразное и за первые 3 часа прошел почти половину пирамиды. Сложность каждого этажа резко возрастает и сложность эта не от количества мобов как оно обычно бывает... В целом приятная игра, от нее быстро устаешь но и возвращаться в нее хочется | El juego es realmente interesante. No tiene muchas cosas novedosas pero si junta muchas cosas que fueron efectivas en otros juegos y arma una buena alternativa.
Aun no lo termine, pero parece ser un juego de duración media, que como mucho puede llevarte un mes para terminarlo completo.
Así y todo, teniendo en cuenta el precio y el contenido, es una alternativa mas que recomendable.

This game could be awesome, but it doesn't work properly. The gameplay, mechanics and everything are great for me, graphics are ok, I don't need more. BUT, as soon as I felt ready to leave the tutorial and start my first game, the maintenance buildings did not repair anything. I chekced if I was doing smthing wrong, but with a quick search on the internet, many people had this problem, and there's no solution. Seems to happen sometimes, depending on how the game starts, but makes the game unplayable. I asked for a refund, and makes me sad, I was really enjoying the game. | Snowtopia is a really fun and calming game and most people wont even get to the amount of hours I have. The game you are paying for is a finished beta, there is not enough features to make it worth 25$ and when i bought it i expected updates that never came. 

The only way in my opinion to play the game in any way of its finished format is with mods. But still with mods the game can get very laggy and make the not fun.

But for someone who loves tycoon games and loves the idea of a ski resort builder i do think the game is good with mods. Although if you don't have the time to download and understand how to use the mods and go into the files and customize the tools and rules of the game. and if you want to play with money change the economy prices i think the game is not worth it. | This is a good game just beware if your buying it the community is bacicly dead and the game doesnt get updates anymore | Plutot sympathique , game play sympa et graphisme gentillet , helas le moteur de jeux a partir de 1200 skieurs soit 4, 5 heures de jeux se met à laguer et bug  .
Dommage  y avait potentiel pour s amuser mais ce bug limite le jeux a quelques heures et pas de correctif .... | This game has huge potential, but it simply doesn't work quite as I imagined, hopefully we'll see a sequel that will be better someday.

The game is just soooo challenging that I can't stop playing! 10/10 highly recommended for those whose minds won't stop thinking haha best game to play before going to sleep <3 | Reviewed after 100% achievements. This game gets significantly more fun the more you view it as a puzzle game rather than a city planning game. You are not trying to build a nice place to live. Instead, you are trying to funnel the right cars to the right places in whatever way works best. This leads you into some city designs which would make absolutely no sense in a normal city builder, but looking at it as a puzzle game, this is not a problem whatsoever. To be clear: there is no goal in the game other than to make roads for the cars to reach the right color of business. The cars will always go the fastest route, and always deploy from the nearest available house, so you don't need to do any management at all other than setting up the roads and trying to plan it so that there isn't gridlock. This simple task never gets boring for long because the demand for cars will ramp up to inifinity until you lose. You can play "endless" mode once you lose, but trying to get the most trips completed before that point is the real draw, like trying to get the highest score or level in Tetris. | Schönes Spiel zum entspannen, ich mag die Grafik sehr.  Viele Maps und Möglichkeiten, wird nicht so schnell langweilig. Kann ich nur weiterempfehlen :) | Игра, в которой получаешь кайф просто от наблюдения за машинками. А потом ты думаешь, а почему бы не попробовать выбить все достижения и..... Ну в целом это реально, я почти все выбил, осталось всякие еженедельные и ежедневные активности закрыть и достижения по числу использований определенных улучшений, но мне стало впадлу это делать. В остальном игра топ, баланс конечно иногда может кинуть подлянку, когда появляются не те цвета где ты их ждешь или неожиданно квадрат в круг превращается. Но в классическом режиме можно все удалять и менять, там проблем особо нет(только ЕБАНН**ЫЙ МУМБАЙ, я на нем для 2000 поездок перепроходил раза 4, причем каждый раз результат был все ближе и ближе к желаемому результату, перед успехом получилось на 1996 закрыть, чуть не сгорел). Могу дать совет трофихантерам - на некоторых картах 2000 проще выбить через челенджи чем через классику. Полезность улучшений зависит от карты, иногда лучше взять светофор или круг, нежели шоссе или мост. Но это вы уже на своем опыте сможете узнать. 
В общем игра топ, и для отдыха подойдет и подумать и погореть, выбивая ачивки, можно. Я очень доволен покупкой, мне больше понравилась эта игра, чем про метро, она более честная в плане сложности. | ---{ Graphics }---

Интересная игра про душевные переживания, буллинг в школе маленькой девочки,за которую нам предстоит пройти ее сознание,победить свои страхи,которые она рисует(противники в игре) и успокоить огромного гиганта,все подробности рассказывать не буду, но игра стоит своих денег и времени, про саму механику игры, обычный карточный рогалик,не добавить не убавить. | I really love this game and hope that one day the developers will fix the minor bugs that still occur during the passage. The fact is that the game is difficult, and even a little inconsistency will easily piss you off. For example, a shield usually protects against traps, but not from a trap that removes all the cards from your hand. But why?! Or thunder usually works on all opponents of the same type, and this rule works on all hydra except red ones. But why?! Or usually, before exiting a level, you can play useless cards like sadness and thus get rid of them. But not when you exit the treasure room level. The game just freezes. These and some other mistakes still spoil this wonderful game, which, thanks to its visual style and simple but touching story, never gets old. | Cute little roguelike, impressively made by a single developer. The gameplay is simple to pick up, and the visuals and sound design are easy on the eyes and ears.

The game attempts to tackle the theme of depression, but its approach is more akin to a sledgehammer than subtlety, which ironically made me laugh out loud. In a strange way, I enjoyed that too, so all's well.

Definitely worth checking out for its charm and effort.

Just started so learning game and slowly acquiring strategy. | War. War never changes. 
Also buy this game.

I've spent so many hours on this game it's painful

While the game has a cute story and was well-produced, you get about 3 hours of playtime for $20 with no replay value. This is a great concept for a game and unique from everything else on the market yet the team is staunchly against expanding on this. Sadly, I don't recommend the game just due to the price point to entertainment ratio. | 好消息，是大伙（指我自己）最爱的收纳小游戏！坏消息，不太适合中国宝宝体质的收纳逻辑！本来主打轻松休闲，很可能因为哪哪都不给放一下子变成高血压游戏（危）。一周目卡关的地方玩得火大让人只想快点收拾干净通关，二周目轻车熟路开始共情细细研究剧情，原来主人公是一个情史坎坷漂泊半生归来终于和老婆夕阳西下HappyEnding，一手抱着崽子一手弹着尤克里里在开满鲜花的BigHouse庭院里喝着下午茶哼着歌的幸福小女孩！

主要卡关的地方大致有这么几处：
·蟑螂药要放在柜顶\水槽\墙角，不能放食物区
·长得像面包机的任天堂主机GameCube要放在客厅电视机附近
·去前男友家同居时无处安放的奖状框必须藏在床底
·长得像白色画板或托盘是冰箱写字板
其他卡关的点一般归于确实从像素图看不出具体内容，比如分不清是洗洁精还是调味品，看不出是洗手液还是沐浴用品，但多尝试放在不同的地方总能成功。

结论：伪收纳游戏，真剧情游戏，所以让我用第一人称捋一下藏在收纳视角下的八点档内容（括弧里是关联的成就）：
我是一个六年级的小学生，出于某种原因我迎来了第一次搬家，幸运的是我拥有了属于自己的蓝色小房间，窗外的庭院有一颗高大的乔木，或许还能搭建我的树屋。从前我有一只小狗，但没能和我们一起搬家就先一步去了天国，于是我把自己画的天使狗海报贴在房间里，仿佛小狗还在我身边。上床下桌和两个橱柜塞满了我带来的旧物什，枕头下的手电筒和被玩偶挤满的床能让我充满安全感，小猪罐总有一天会存满的，忠实的游戏玩家从来不会落下最爱的桌游棋盘、DND人偶、GameBoy和拓麻歌子，越来越熟练的公式让我足以表演现场复原魔方【解决难题】，科幻漫画和森林童话陪我度过了许多无聊的睡前故事时间，还有一台宝丽来相机【创造回忆】记录精彩时刻，磁带播放机则为我的涂鸦时间提供创作灵感，足球是我最喜欢的运动项目，那座足球状的金奖杯足以说明一切。最最最重要的，我的非主流日记本绝对不能让任何人看见，要么锁在抽屉要么收在枕头底下。【起点】

转眼已经是大学开学前，我搬进了学生公寓的单人宿舍，这里有一厨一卫一卧，尽管努力按场景打包了箱子还是有些东零西落的。有些东西变了，我的粉色双肩包换成了更成熟的蓝色单肩包，爱看的绘本也变成了更厚的砖头本，老掉牙的卡带机换成了更时髦的足球唱片机【大声播放音乐】，我拥有了台式机和桌面电子钟，旅行纪念品巴黎铁塔摆件，枕头下放的是新买的随身听，在经历初潮后卫生间要常备棉条和卫生巾，为了让糟糕的厨艺也能做点吃的赶紧购置锅碗瓢盆和刀叉勺子，遗忘的糖果罐被放在橱柜顶【偶尔啃两口】，我还顺势成了十足的杯子控。自从有了自己的衣柜，我开始在镜子前喷香水和梳造型，虽然只有牛仔裤和几件T恤卫衣，但感觉也够酷了。当然有的东西并没变，我还是那个能飞速复原魔方的小女孩，偶尔颠两下的足球虽然有些破旧但还算干净，儿时的玩偶玩具和那台掌机陪我流浪，小猪存钱罐摆放时沉甸甸的声音预告它快满了，依旧热爱画画且买了新的彩笔和线圈素描本，还有一个木制的关节人偶用于练习，嘻哈超人的pose实在太帅了。【摆个姿势】【学富五车】

到大三实习，为了方便通勤和节省可怜的生活费，我找了个三人的合租公寓，我们共用客厅厨房和淋浴间，为了不打扰别人我没有乱动她们的物品，努力在剩下的空隙为我的行李们寻找落脚处。新的厨房非常宽敞，客厅的大屏幕足以让人爽玩GameCube和新买的游戏卡带们【开始游戏】，二十面骰准备就绪，等不及和大家开一局跑团了。CRT显示器退休了，现在是液晶屏的时代，GameBoy也换成了GBA，还有全新的小鸡系列收集品。闲暇时间的活动当然是继续磨炼画技，买了更多的线圈本、人体结构教材、新的马克笔套装和新的的数位板，停止踢球后，我开始玩飞盘和练瑜伽，骄傲地把赢得的荣誉奖状裱框挂墙。二十出头需要更加注意形象，我学会了化妆，衣品也丰富起来，尝试看着更成熟的半身裙，甚至用上了剃毛刀，别忘了刚领的工作围裙，再给假人戴上我的绿帽【头戴帽子】。游戏之夜和电影之夜快要到来了，希望合租生活的一切往好的方向发展。【团队】

毕业后我和男友商量，决定搬到他的公寓同居，这里一个人住绰绰有余，但两个人实在显得逼仄拥挤，加上我们还养了一只爬宠。男友很有个性，听黑胶摇滚乐，墙上还挂着他的贝斯，喜欢健身和咖啡，客厅的角落摆满哑铃组架，厨房柜子也塞满他的蛋白粉，餐桌上则是他大大小小的咖啡设备【冲泡咖啡】，原来世界上的咖啡不只有速溶。虽然想快点收拾好衣物，遗憾的是卧室的抽屉都散放着他的内衣和袜子，需要先替他收拾整齐才能放进我的【收拾整齐】，我们外套和裤子混放在一起，勉强塞满了卧室的衣柜，书包已经是很遥远的事情，现在陪伴我的是一个颇具职场风的紫色皮包和中跟鞋，同时开始尝试的还有卷头发和穿连衣裙。至于我的画本、数位板和笔记本，失去办公桌，在这间卧室很难找到容身之处，更多时候我会把它们留在客厅里，至少不是放在卫生间【触电危险】。家中四处是大玻璃窗，墙壁挂满了男友的装饰画却没给我的荣誉证书留下位置，甚至厕所的墙壁也不行，最后只能塞进床底。粉色小猪玩偶肚子破了，我用针线缝了又补但做得并不算好，最喜欢的紫色爱心杯子也摔碎了口子，不舍得扔掉便放在淋浴间当做漱口杯。还有一件惊喜的事情，淋浴间窗外的夜晚的江景很棒，算是这个拥挤的家里为数不多让人放松的存在。虽说要开始同居了，但我和他或许并没有想象中那么兴趣相投，于是我买了乐器和教材，开始自学尤克里里，或许音乐会带来更多的共同话题。【太酷了】

两年后，我终于受不了男友的打压和控制选择了分手，再次看到这张照片时我愤怒地把图钉扎在双人合照的他的脸上，接着把照片扔进了角落。为了调整心情，我带着爬宠搬回老家，要说这里有什么不同，或许现在妹妹再也不会因为浴室和我吵架了，一想到永远有一个等我回去的小房间，便觉得莫名踏实下来。小时候觉得很大的地方，现在却显得这么小，但至少有充足的位置摆放我的奖杯奖状、绘图工具和笔记本电脑，我从柜子里翻到儿时那张傻里傻气的天使狗海报，重新贴到墙壁上【重温童年】，掌机新宠3DS也加入了这个家庭。画师久坐的职业病让我开始腰疼，为疲惫的身体安排上贴膏和热水袋，桌面多了缝纫机和针线包，相信只要认真练习手工活儿，就能更好缝补跟随我颠沛流离的玩偶们。【家常菜】

在老家住了一年，我鼓起勇气搬出来独立，寻求新的开始，庆幸我依靠仅有的积蓄找到了一处不错的房源，尽管一些地方有些破旧，但各种功能区齐全，还有一张专属于我的双人大床。我没再做兼职，而是在新房子里腾出一个房间专门做为艺术工作室，买了更大的画架，墙上的人物设计稿初具雏形，爬宠也去了天国，墙上多了一副我为它画了纪念照，打印和传真能让我更好和责编沟通。厨房添置了一台微波炉，各种时间档位用来加热食物刚刚好【12:00】，等待时间很无聊，发现摆弄数字冰箱贴刚好可以拼出等式【灵机一动】，在那之后我易经习惯喝手冲咖啡，还买了新的模具开始学习烘培。衣柜多了不少新买的衣服，一些漂亮的女式小吊带和连衣裙，甚至还有一双彩虹袜子，或许我有了新的喜欢的人，要是能让她明白我的心意就好了。【独立自主】

经过两年的相处，我的女朋友决定搬来我的公寓和我同居，她是一个可爱的亚裔姑娘，和我一样热爱桌游，但她有更多的化妆品，和令人眼花缭乱的吊带衬衫与褶裙，家里很快充满了各种她喜爱的粉色和红色物件，厨房也摆满新奇的炊具，像是沥水架和蒸笼，搅拌机、刨丝器、擦板和电饭煲。她很细心，擅长侍弄花花草草，几乎每个角落都布置了她亲手栽培的绿植，家中也因此充满了生命和活力。【园艺奇才】我们的物品开始变得成双成对，一模一样的内衣收纳柜，一模一样的餐桌垫，一模一样的情侣服，还买了一对床头对讲机，她的小老虎玩偶也和我的粉猪玩偶并排在那张双人床上【毛绒好友】，这个家的一切突然都变得如此温馨惬意，另一边，艺术工作室的业务也逐渐有了成色，书架上摆放着我的新秀奖杯和勋章。【爱情】

在故事的最后，我依旧经常去四处旅行，囤了各种纪念品，和妻子凭借努力住进了双层小别墅，有车库和额外的厕所，有单独的衣物间，有可以养宠物的后院，还为领养的孩子准备了婴儿房，从厨房冰箱上贴的照片可以看到我们仍然很恩爱，她是一个前刘海有红色挑染的美女。在工作室拆开包裹，我的作品终于要出版实体书，收到了编辑寄来的一箱样册，还留下了当时的宣传海报作为纪念，充足的稿费支持我购置了更大的数位板和更高配置的主机显示器，生活的一切充满了期待。尾声的彩蛋是一个再平常不过的午后，在落日余晖里窥见了这个小家庭的背影，鲜花庭院里喝着茶，一人弹着吉他，另一人抱着孩子静静聆听（唱的歌大概就是ED，很温馨很可爱，安静听完还会有点小感动）。【最美好的家】 | I completed this game ages ago but never wrote a review and that's criminal of me. I followed this game during its development. I love pixel art and games like this are so up my alley. And it didn't disappoint. I didn't expect to feel so emotional during a game about unpacking but the way they weave the story through all the levels is masterful. The art is gorgeous and overall it's such a whimsical, wholesome experience. Truly a cosy, chill game. | This game has a very interesting way to convey a story, it has a very relaxing and slow paced gameplay.
If you are a detail oriented person you will notice several bits of information that shows what happened between each chapter of this person life.
It's unlike anything I played before and that's the sole reason I'm recommending it, although I wouldn't pay the full price and wait for when it goes on sale. | A super cosy and adorable game that does an amazing job at delivering a strong narrative without saying a word!

The choices are based on how lucky you are, there is no logic within them unless they're made to choose between two characters+ you're stuck with the first person you're matched with | A good game, but a step down compared to the first one. Also the RNG on the endings is way too low, it took me over an hour to get some of the endings and it wasn't because I was being dumb and not picking the right responses it was because they wouldn't spawn. Going through an entire run just for the ending you want to not pop up is really lame especially when all of the events are things you have seen before. | Terry, I found you being tempted by Batniss to join a love triangle. Though the temptation was high, you brushed her aside and shared with me your secret of monster camp, that you and I are the same. I await the day we can meet in meatspace and finally be together. At the start i thought it was worse than the first, now i think its twice as good. How do you make a game twice as good as a 10/10 game ? It's not even finished... | Hades 2 em acesso antecipado consegue ser melhor e mais completo, não só do que Hades 1, mas também do que 90% dos jogos vazios e "sem alma" lançados pela grande industria dos games atualmente.
É incrível como a Supergiant Games com uma equipe relativamente pequena se dedica ao máximo em cada mínimo detalhe dos jogos. 
Aos fãs do jogo, recomendo que assistam ao documentário "Hades: Developing Hell" disponível no Youtube, que mostra a jornada de desenvolvimento de Hades 1. | 本来刚出的时候还是蛮期待的，第一时间通关了克洛诺斯，那时候还是蛮好玩的。
但经过几轮更新，游戏出现了很多很严重的问题，导致我的游戏体验非常的糟糕，感觉没得到什么好的体验反而浪费了很多时间，所以把我认为不好玩的地方列举如下：

1：大量关于Ω（蓄力）技能和魔法的祝福，对于喜欢纯物理攻击的人来说，
这些新要素非常的难上手，尤其是在一个满屏幕都是怪一不小心就暴毙的动作游戏，蓄力的性价比太低，魔法更是难以上手，这种情况下应该给予玩家选择的权利，而不是死板的把主人公定位为一个女巫强制玩家使用巫术。

2：不！要！妄！图！往！动！作！游！戏！里！加！MMO！游！戏！的！走！位！机！制！
主要体现在新boss普罗米修斯上，打到一定阶段普罗米修斯会让他的鹰会把场地分成3块进行乱序的放火，玩家需要记住鹰的标识，配合鹰在放火时进行走位，如果走不对会被秒杀。这是典型的mmo走位机制。

很多动作游戏开发商在做不出什么新玩法之后，总是妄图把mmo这种慢节奏的走位机制强行加进快节奏的动作游戏里，这不是创新，这是徒增玩家的负担。要是整不出新活来就别整。【没有创新】比【游戏变粪】哪个对游戏造成的伤害更大奉劝制作组掂量掂量。

本来就是boss技能满天飞，场地上还有火限制走位，boss的鹰还在AOE，谁还有时间记忆你那套广播体操还陪你玩？
人们玩动作游戏是为了打击感和爽快感，不是来被“教育”被“训练”的。
大家要“玩”游戏而不是被游戏玩！

3：要搞懂“难度”和“不讲理（粪）”的区别！
首先是到了后期，主人公的强化明显追不上新内容的难度了。
卡牌的强化和数量根本就不够你在地表世界跑那么远。尤其是到了普罗米修斯面前，有的玩家已经注意力涣散了，注意力很难集中，输了回家还发现根本没有什么东西可以升级，只能怪自己“菜”。还得被地表那嘴臭boss骂，体验能好？

前半段冥界的克洛诺斯虽然有些走位机制的端倪，但还算比较容易，给反应的时间也是足够的，而且相对好打，但地上部分就尤其的无聊且又臭又长。体感上大概有冥界的1.5倍，但增益却往往距离挑战普罗米修斯差很远。
把每一段远征都做的又臭又长那不叫“可玩性高”。建议在奥林匹斯酒神那里设置一个中继点给玩家做休整和存档，地表的部分实在是太长了。

目前来说想说的就这么多了，期待后期的更新吧，下次我再打开游戏的时候如果没有改善的话我差不多也该放弃了。
 | Baller game. Super fun gameplay. The story is good - much more meaningful if you've played the first one but it's great even if you haven't. Very difficult but definitely something you can improve on with experience. love the mechanics with the boons too. | 承诺年初更新言而无信，到了二月中旬仍无音讯，四个月没有一点儿新内容，没有不给差评的理由吧。

世界上最好玩的肉鸽之一，神中神，剧情画风游戏模式都绝了 | [h1]Comentario Analítico: "Hades"[/h1]

Hades es el resultado de depurar hasta el hartazgo lo que fueron Bastion y Transistor, más una dinámica Rogue-Like y una interpretación juvenil y mayormente desenfadada de la mitología Greco-Romana.

Desde sus decisiones artísticas tanto visuales como musicales hasta la comodidad de sus controles o la efectividad de sus mecánicas, apenas hay aspectos en los que Hades denote flaqueza. Su argumento se va desenvolviendo a medida que acumulamos escapes, esta es además la primera vez que veo tan bien justificados los reinicios (Propios de un Rogue-like) en la historia de un juego.

Por desgracia cada partida comparte demasiadas similitudes como para decir que logra mantenerse fresco, en esos términos todavía gobierna el jueguito del feto llorón.

[b]¿En conclusión?[/b] Es tan bueno que estrenaron Hades 2, y Supergiant nunca puso un 2 en algún título, poca broma. | Every time I open this game I'm inspired all over again by the gorgeous art. The story is fantastic and the way the game incorporates dying into its mechanics is perfect for keeping players invested and building up experience. It took me an embarrassingly long time to actually beat the game and get the epilogue, but I had fun doing it! | Its a Action Roguelike RPG & RLY Good                                                                                                                                        This art is beautiful
Voice acting is incredible
The lore backdrop fits perfectly
The gameplay is smooth
The game is easy to understand and hard to master
The amount of content in this game is astounding

The best single player experience I've had in a long time | 论剧情，整体是基于希腊神话而改编的作品，得益于希腊神话故事的错综复杂与有趣，使得整个游戏剧情上的人物便有许多对话可写，扎格列欧斯与神明的互动到众神之间的互动，几乎每一把都有新的对话产生。与之相伴的还有好感度，随着好感度上升解锁信物和越加亲密的对话。能与希腊神明近距离互动，着实是一个有趣的体验。本人最喜阿尔忒秘斯的形象，一是喜爱其所代表的领域，狩猎与自然，二是形象上，恩，这是个人喜好。
在背景故事上可以岔开来说一件事，就是希腊神话与人间秩序的关系，这也是我打游戏时候一直所想的。在神话设定中，神明都有所统治的领域，如战争之于阿瑞斯，爱情之于Aphrodite，狩猎之于Artemis，死亡之于hades等。神明是与人间的秩序所息息相关的，Hades在游戏中所重复的一句话，若凡人不害怕死亡，则还畏惧什么（大意应该是这样），由此也作为自己在地府中所操劳的理由。故不仅仅把希腊神话作为神明之间的故事来看，而是构建人间的秩序来看希腊神话，应该发现很多关于故事新的寓意所在，比如Orpheus欲带妻子从地府归来，其最终是以失败的告终，原因在于其因为其好奇违背了契约，若从构建秩序的来看，其寓意何在？对于契约的遵守？还是死亡的绝对性。其神话中各个英雄的故事，其应代表了一个文明所倡导的人格导向，那么英雄的悲剧，比如赫拉克勒斯的杀妻与十二试炼，这指向的什么？以上这是神话的内部构造的导向。其次是从神话与人间的互动来看，最典型的是以神明起誓，在游戏中是以hades之名，来获取神明的祝福。在现实中，这种习惯也是存在于希腊文明之中，其所发的誓言是以人的行为和神明所代表领域所相关的，如苏格拉底便常常以宙斯起誓，其欲带表之后的话的坚定或真实等。这种以神明来起誓的行为正是神话与人间秩序的互动所在，参见到中国，亦有“举头三尺有神明”，“天知地知”。这种构造可能是早期文明维持秩序的关键所在。我很好奇这种习惯是如何最初被构造出来并且传播。
论美术，这美术很好，特别是神明的立绘，是我一开始玩这个游戏的原因。要说怎么好吧，这一点说不来，我对于鉴赏艺术并不在行，只是符合自己顺眼的感觉，好听一点的话，就是这艺术与人内在目的的相互契合。
论机制，这个游戏的正反馈机制设计的很好，拉着我连续沉迷了三天，我根据我的自身体验来谈为何这个容易上瘾。首先是rogue机制，作为基底的武器种类与神明赐福的组合来带来不同的感觉，由此来刺激你去组合出各自不同的组合，我比较喜欢的是武器是罗摩弓和磁力拳套，赐福是Artemis的追踪箭搭配赫尔墨斯的快速攻击，刷刷刷地就清屏了。其次是人物，这游戏的文本量相对丰富，主要是体现在人物的对话上，几乎每一局游戏，你都可以与游戏人物展开新的对话，这个在rogue游戏里可不多见。且人物可能因为你的行为而产生出颇为有趣的对话，比如Hades会吐槽你在神殿的各种装修，在与神明对抗中选择使用神明的赐福，赠予蜜露以及美酒后产生的良性反馈。这一点促使我进行了后两天的游戏。不过比较难受的一点就是对话的随机性，导致一些解锁好感度对话需要很久才会出现，比如解锁好感度限度的对话，不少人物的好感度解锁对话真是难寻，以及解锁武器的新形态也是如此，我现在还没刷出chaos关于盾的对话，md好感度都满了。最后能够提供正反馈的就是各种收集和肝的系统，信物的等级，称号的等级，这些我是肝不动了。

It was both hilarious and intriguing, and I really loved the gameplay. I would restart chapters over and over just to get perfect scores. Honestly, I can't really think of any negatives. Absolutely love this game.  Has all the theming of Binding of Isaac in a unique take on a match 4 game.

Negative:
Let me get the bad out of the way first.  Yes, the game can be buggy at times, but not unplayable.  Also, the game feels a bit short with a limited number of enemies; hoping the team returns to this game someday and it gets the Binding of Isaac treatment.

Positive:
To help with people struggling, this isn't about matching 4 tiles and you win.  At its core, it's actually about intelligent resource management.  Knowing what spells to cast when and how to extend your turn as long as possible.  If you're being damaged, you're doing something wrong (or you have bad luck when building your deck)!

I also appreciate how each character forces you to approach the game wildly different.  Tactics vary from straight up "Match 4" to "Use spells and only spells this whole run".

Lastly, the music/sound/design all feel right at home in the Isaac universe.  Incredible work.

TLDR;
If you like strategy games, you'll love this.  If not, it can feel unfair at times and be frustrating.  Just stick with it and it'll grow on ya. | I actually really like this game. It's engaging to play and provides a good amount of challenge.
The visuals are fun and I enjoy the added lore the TBOI that you get with this.

But I just cannot endorse it with how buggy it is even years after launch.

I had to install a mod just to get achievements to sync properly with the game progression.
And several times I've had to manually quit the game because it froze in the middle of a run.
(Which the game punishes you for by restarting the last encounter with several curse tiles :))) )
There's also several visual glitches that occur every once in a while.

What atracted me to this game was the artstyle, as you may have noticed Going Under uses the style known as corporate Memphis, which is used by every corporation on Earth to sell an image of inclusion and friendliness in a very soulless way. Based on the ratings it already has, this game clearly has an audience that loves it. Personally I got it because I liked "Papers, Please" and this was recommended as being similar. I don't find it very similar at all.

I found the design and presentation to be perfectly fine and attractive and all that.

Rather than tear apart a perfectly serviceable project with opinions that almost nobody will read, I'll simply say that the gameplay loop didn't work for me. I gave it a full 28 day in-game cycle, just to be sure, but ultimately it left me uninspired to give it another cycle. Given that the developers clearly intend for the player to take several passes at it, and I'm left feeling more like I'll never get those two and a half hours back, I can't recommend it.

Maybe if you can get this title on sale for $2 or so (it goes on sale periodically), pick it up and see if it appeals to you. | Очень интересная игра, поражающая своей вариативностью. Игрок "проживает" "жизнь" работника небесной канцелярии, в обязанности которого входит решение: жить человеку или умереть. Каждый выбор влияет на состояние мира. Игрок либо приводит человечество в вечное благоденствие, либо окутывает его мраком и ужасом. Концовок много, выбор реплик большой. Присутствует магазин с предметами, облегчающими прохождение. Также есть бар, где каждый выходные можно послушать истории различный "душ" и выпить коктейли, влияющие на мировые характеристики. А ещё в игре можно развлечься перед зеркалом, экспериментируя с внешностью своего жнеца. Это зеркало умеет разговаривать и сводит героя с ума...
После первого прохождения решил, что хочу выбить платину. Второе прохождение понравилось, так же, как и третье. Но с каждым последующим становилось всё менее интересно. Это всё я к чему. Некоторые достижения выбивать чрезвычайно сложно. Требуется перепроходить игру около 10 раз. А для сюжетного приключения это вообще не очень. Пока что я не выбил платину и не знаю, получится ли у меня это вообще. Если интересно добил ли я её на момент прочтения обзора- зайдёте, в профиль, всё открыто.

Теперь краткая информация про игру: вы играете за жнеца, который должен решать судьбы людей. Все ваши действия продвигают вас в сюжете. Также вы можете идти против главного (Рика), и в будущем, я уверен, там откроют секрет, что это за место.

好玩，剧情和关卡很新奇，刚开始玩的时候不用小心翼翼，除非看攻略走正确路线，要不然都大差不差 | What I enjoyed:
At first I started this game trying to go in blind. I greatly enjoyed playing the various cards and discovering various interactions and hidden away tidbits in each area and loved being rewarded when I completed small side jobs in each chapter with a new card that gave me new strategies. Plenty of parts of the game have various conclusions & ways to complete tasks that make it fun. Bribe, boast, threaten, discourage or simply defeat enemies during combat, lots of fun routes to play. Sometimes there are even story related resolutions to a conflict via certain items. Some events end differently depending on the items you have on hand or number of pursuers, an early example is the prison break having a satisfyingly obvious difference between having pursuers VS no pursuers. You can even be rewarded depending on how well you perform certain story events. The game has certain consequences along the story as well if you rack up a body count. The game is designed to be played multiple times through each avenue to reach the finish line, and certain knowledge previously obtained helps make future runs easier (figuratively & literally, as prison break has multiple entrances and one can literally be recalled in game and is given as a card item).

What I hated:
There is no skip dialogue or cut-scene button, and for a game that is LITERALLY about replay-ability this is fairly unacceptable. And considering a release date of 2022 that issue isn't likely to be resolved. To top it all off, if you BEAT the game, your save becomes disabled for some insane reason and it simply says congratz thanks for playing (so bear that in mind for true ending pursuit, or lookup how to copy over your save and finish it on a secondary file). Some routes have only a single conclusion to reach, and if you lack the cards to get there or don't understand you might replay a chapter over and over again being stuck and walking in circles not understanding the objective. While you do unlock new cards, they are only for THAT RUN, meaning even tho the games story literally circles back until you reach the "true ending" you lose those new abilities. I personally found this disappointing as getting new tricks only to lose them feels bad.

What I recommend:
If you purchase this game, understand that unless you follow the guide on the forum you WILL fail a few missions or intentionally restart them. And you will have to sit through some dialogue you've already heard until you can get back to the fun. There is lots of fun finding where cards can be used, conventionally and unconventionally (elephant sneeze) and it honestly feels very well thought out in some area's and not so much in others. Near the end you WILL find some "not so obvious" clauses that, so far as i've seen, have only one proper resolution. There is only one walkthrough for this game that I have found and its not all encompassing but DOES get you to the finale, so even if you get frustrated with walking circles you will have a cheat sheet, don't hesitate to use it.

The game is fun, but unless the developer finally decides to fix the lack of dialogue & cut-scene skip for something you will see multiple times, its definitely not for everyone. I would very much recommend the game, but definitely understand "what" you are getting does have a few missing key features and poor design choices in general & later chapters (some are my opinion, some are factual "why is this feature missing"). | 好玩，风格类似跑团桌游，通过探索不同地点和它们产生交互。缺点是回档功能在结局出现后就不能使用，导致有时剧情突然结束，产生大量重复工作。 | I really like this game for his gimmicks. I speedrun it and I encourage to try it. | 유니티 한국어 기계번역으로 해서 진행하고있는데 생각보다 스토리 진행하는 맛 있어서 재밌습니다

To anyone wanting to play this game but worried about the difficulty being too high:
The "assisted mode" is a great way to play though all the content without being frustrated by particularly difficult levels. If you're not great at pure action game but still want to experience The Ambassador because you think the art style or time ability is awesome, don't worry there's a mode for you! This is how I've chosen to play the game.

To anyone wanting to play this game but worried about the difficulty being too low:
There's a hard mode available after finishing the game on standard and each map has a challenge time to beat that is going to take some serious skill to beat. I don't think there's a lot to worry about if you want a challenge. | This is just such a simplistic game, I don't see why it's rated so highly.. and it costs $15 to top it off?!

Yea, no thanks.

遊戲機制簡介：雙搖桿射擊遊戲-以投擲迴旋鏢的方式投出各種武器，或是換成法杖用有限的MP發射魔法，可以短暫的暫停時間，可以累積肉品在身上隨時補血。

不喜歡的理由：
等待武器回來實在莫名奇妙，以近距離的方式（縮短武器回來時間）殺敵又不順，方向不對就無法連擊，以拉打方式遊玩遇上多數敵人就只能用暫停時間來躲。
菁英怪或BOSS要等他發完大招(衝撞到牆壁為止或是噴出一堆小怪)才能打，感覺非常拖延時間。
畫面醜，故事有但是感覺很敷衍。

游戏是在2年前通关的，一款3D平台动作游戏。游戏的封面和介绍以为是恐怖吓人的，实则不然；反而更像是搞怪捉弄风格。游戏更是发行于万圣节，属于是相得益彰了。
I completed this game two years ago. It’s a 3D platformer action game. Judging by its cover and description, you’d think it’s a scary horror game, but that’s not the case; it’s more of a quirky and playful style. The game was even released on Halloween, making it a perfect fit for the occasion.

主角杰克战斗虽爽可过于简单；战斗系统略差；关卡重复度较高；剧情流程不长；收集完毕通关之后就再也没有打开的必要了。想一想原价108元的售价，就感觉有点不值，在打折时入手是个正确的选择。
While the combat with the protagonist Jack is fun, it’s overly simple; the combat system is somewhat lacking; the levels feel repetitive; the story progression is short; and once you’ve collected everything and completed the game, there’s no reason to replay it. Considering the original price of 108 CNY, it feels a bit overpriced. Getting it during a sale is definitely the better choice.

 | Aqui esta um game divertido, simples, num estilo um pouco "kids", mas que em tempos de halloween cai bem como uma luva!!!!!!

Pumpkin Jack é um game de genero plataforma que mistura um pouco de ação e aventura. Durante a jornada, comandamos Jack, uma horripilante abobora que tem o dever de espalhar o caos e o mal, em busca de derrotar um grande bruxo, que acaba jogando um feitiço ao mundo. 

Por se tratar de um jogo indie, vale lembrar que os cenarios apresentados aqui são bem interessantes!!! Chega a ser tudo muito "fofinho" e bem agradavel aos olhos. 
As cores adotadas nos lugares & personagens ficaram muito boas e atraentes a quem vê. Nada muito poluido!! 

Na parte de gameplay, é tudo legalzinho, sendo bem executado. Conforme você vai avançando as fases, novas armas vão sendo liberadas.
O jogo até possui algumas skinszinhas pro Jack, mas isso é detalhe. Os Puzzles aqui aplicados são bemmmm bemmmm simples e intuitivos. EZPZ total!!!! 

Em relação a trilha sonora, dublagens & legendas eu diria que é tudo bem +/-. A trilha creio eu que foi voltada para ser algo mais "leve" e "minimalista". Se eu fosse definir em uma palavra, eu diria: JUVENIL.
Agora, a parte de dublagens & legendas ja me agradou mais!! A dublagem é bem bacaninha, e a legenda é bem boa sim! Até nos pequenos detalhes. 

Pra encerrar, bugs... bom, não presenciei nenhum de fato. Mas é possivel que tenha algum bugzinho durante a campanha sim. Porem é aquilo... nada que seja totalmente prejudicial a jogatina. 
Tive uma gameplay de 5 horinhas e meia num Deck LCD 256GB e tudo rodou nos conformes da padronização hehehehe ^^ 

E é isso!!!!!!! Recomendo sim este titulo, mas lembrando que é um indie e curtinho. Porem, não deixa de ser bom, pra quem gosta do estilo vai achar bem legal a proposta que Pumpkin Jack nos traz.

Пофанитья здесь тоже можно) | This game is incredible, I see people saying the game isn't balanced right for two players but my friend and I made it to the end on every single run we played and even won one. And we were both playing mage on the one we won. Team composition doesn't seem as important as synergy between each other's builds. We were constantly moving bad guys around and detonating bombs to stun and hurt them. I can't recommend this game more than enough. It's challenging, has 5 classes, and a lot of rewards. It is basically co op slay the spire with more tactical combat.

The game itself has potential but where it falls down is how outdated the game design feels and the AI control over your units. It harkens back to an era of micromanagement of unit abilities which we really should have moved beyond. I don't find it personally enjoyable to have to babysit my infantry units telling them when to use their grenades or other such basic combat abilities. Realistically that sort of micromanagement should be toggleable or in cases where it's not limited by resource but is time delayed by cooldowns should be automatic. 

I've also come across serious AI issues in which sometimes I would tell three rifle units to attack move and on seeing the enemy well within range they will continue to move rather than stop and fight. In those cases I mention their firing lanes were not blocked. On other occasions where their firing lanes were blocked they did indeed stop and contributed nothing to the fight. This has led to me losing pushes when I was counting on that to function properly in taking an area I knew they only had warriors while I focused on retaking a bigger fight. The end result being the fight which should have been a clear victory instead resulted in my troops being annihilated because I could not micro manage two fights simultaneously.

If these two key things are improved - AI and the abilities - I can see this being much enjoyable and a recommend for those interested in this sort of game. | Thoroughly enjoyed the main campaign, sadly lacking replay value. I like the concept of staggering your approaches more than I like it in execution because you will inevitably run into a situation where youre moving up some of your units while one or more cover the rear only to realize that in the 3 seconds it took to move up said units, a tanker bug came around a corner and instantly killed a full rifle squad, and your recruitment base is on the other side of the map so youre SOL. I know it's sacrilegious to say but this game really would benefit from a pause or slow time feature. [h1] [La idea de un nabo rebelde que evade impuestos es muy absurda, pero funciona de **** madre. La exploración simple, el arte del juego y su humor te mantiene enganchado hasta el platino] [/h1]

[h1] Puntuación: 8/10 [/h1]

[h2] Gráficos: [/h2]

El apartado visual de [i] Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion [/i] es uno de sus mayores aciertos. Su estilo gráfico adorable y colorido, similar al de [i] Forager [/i], logra transmitir una atmósfera encantadora y ligera que encaja perfectamente con el tono humorístico del juego. Los personajes y entornos están diseñados con una atención al detalle que los hace memorables, y cada rincón del mapa está lleno de elementos visuales que refuerzan el estilo caricaturesco y simpático.

[h2] Gameplay: [/h2]

La jugabilidad es sencilla pero efectiva. Combina exploración, resolución de puzles y combates ligeros, manteniendo una experiencia ágil y divertida. Una de las características más destacadas son los chistes y referencias constantes, que añaden un toque de humor irreverente y logran que el juego se sienta fresco y dinámico. Sin embargo, la necesidad de recorrer el mapa repetidamente puede volverse un poco tediosa, especialmente en zonas más alejadas. A pesar de esto, el diseño de niveles y las mecánicas básicas son lo suficientemente entretenidos como para mantener el interés hasta el final.

[h2] Historia: [/h2]

La trama es sencilla, pero no por ello menos divertida. La premisa de un nabo rebelde que evade impuestos es tan absurda como hilarante, y el juego aprovecha esta idea para construir una narrativa llena de humor y situaciones extravagantes. Aunque no es una historia profunda ni compleja, su tono ligero y las interacciones con los personajes hacen que sea muy disfrutable.

[h2] Relación calidad/precio: [/h2]
 
Por su duración y contenido, [i] Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion [/i] ofrece una relación calidad/precio razonable, especialmente si se adquiere en oferta. El juego no es muy largo, pero su encanto visual, humor y mecánicas entretenidas hacen que valga la pena. Además, incita a completar todos sus desafíos y secretos, lo que añade valor para quienes disfrutan de platinar juegos.

[h2] Conclusión: [/h2]

[i] Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion [/i] es un juego encantador y entretenido que combina un estilo visual adorable con un humor irreverente y mecánicas accesibles. Aunque el backtracking puede resultar un poco molesto, su propuesta general es lo suficientemente fresca y divertida como para recomendarlo. Es ideal para quienes buscan una experiencia ligera, llena de risas y con un toque único. | Fun little silly game. It takes an extreme tonal shift towards the end and then goes back to being silly. Very short game, I 100%'d it in 3 hours. Still a silly and fun game nonetheless, but I'd recommend buying it on sale. | This game was very enjoyable. The jokes were funny and the bosses were fun but not too hard. It reminded me of Link to the Past which I would assume the game was based on as there are puzzles throughout the game and the boss battles are similar too. The story was pretty good, it started out all cutesy and ended up turning a bit dark. I would give this game a solid 8/10, Its a short game but that's okay. 스토리텔링이 진짜 좋네요

다음 작품은 언제 나오려나

Suzerain é um dos melhores jogos políticos de escolha já desenvolvidos, ainda que esse gênero não tenha muitos representantes (o que é uma pena). Se considerarmos um simulador político mais modernizado e próximo de Suzerain, podemos citar [i]Democracy 4[/i] por conta de sua profundidade na área política; no entanto, o grande problema desse jogo é que sua jogabilidade se resume a equilibrar números, sem oferecer uma experiência imersiva nas decisões políticas (sem desmerecer o jogo, ele até que é bom). Em Suzerain, por outro lado, o impacto das escolhas é genuinamente sentido, criando uma pressão real ao tomar todas as decisões, pois a maioria delas possui consequências significativas num futuro talvez muito próximo. É uma obra que desafia sua visão ideológica, se está disposto a seguir ela até o fim sem esperar consequências graves.

 Em determinado momento, precisei tomar uma decisão difícil para manter as contas do governo positivas, o que exigiu cortes no orçamento de um ministério. Fui duramente criticado e, ao aprofundar-me no problema, precisei escolher com ainda mais precisão qual setor interno sofreria a redução de recursos – ambos de grande importância. A experiência transmite de forma autêntica os dilemas enfrentados na administração pública, sendo tentador, em alguns momentos, ceder à tentação de ignorar o equilíbrio fiscal e gastar sem restrições (Olá, Lula da Silva).

 O jogo é inteiramente baseado em texto, estando disponível apenas em inglês e sem previsão de uma tradução muito fiel ao jogo, adotando uma linguagem formal condizente com o contexto político e institucional. Embora não seja impossível de entender, é comum recorrer a um tradutor para compreender plenamente os diálogos, já que cada interação fornece informações cruciais para a tomada de decisões estratégicas para a nação. Como pretendo seguir carreira em Relações Internacionais, Suzerain se mostra uma excelente introdução ao vocabulário político e diplomático em inglês (língua base), tornando-se um ótimo ponto de partida para aprofundar meu conhecimento na área. É uma mina de ouro para mim. | This is a Visual Novel with a Political theme to it, not an actual Political Simulator. Once you've accepted that, it's a very good Visual Novel about building the "Story" of the character you take charge of.

If you come in with the expectation that you'll be able to do your own thing the way you want them to, like any PoliSim, then prepare to be disappointed. Choices are limited to a select number of options with little degree of variance and you can only tackle issues as they come up, as the story demands. You do not have the ability to proactively decide when or how to handle various issues because as mentioned before, this is a Visual Novel, not a Political Simulator.

As a Visual Novel, is it any good? It's okay, but nothing extraordinary. More variety in routes and endings stemming from past choices would make this more memorable, but the variations are only mild, enough to see some change,  but not significant enough to completely alter the trajectory. That, and the story has tendencies to throw "gotcha" moments near the end that force you to steer your character in a specific direction very early on unless you like repeating the same ending for a dozen playthroughs.

TL;DR get it on sale | Game was a bit of a disappointment after my first time through. You are given very limited options to actually govern your nation in a successful way. It's as if every thing is pre-decided to stop you from governing in a way that isn't exactly one or two paths. El como es llevada la historia puede ser un tanto tedioso debido a la alta cantidad de dialogos que tiene el juego, personalmente no me gusta mucho pero entiendo que el genero al que pertenece se desarrolla asi comunmente.
Plantea tomas de desiciones interesantes y te te atrapa con el como procedera la historia ya que este parece variar bastante dependiendo del resultado en los enfrentamientos, los cuales son muchos. Personalmente quitaria la opcion de reiniciar los enfrentamientos ya que le daria mas emocion al tener que ganar para lograr los resultados deseados.
En sintesis, disfrute mucho el gameplay, esta muy bien pensado y es divertido el dominar todas las formas que tnes de jugar con cada personaje, resulto tedioso en los momentos de mucho texto y personalmente no termine aprendiendo mucho del lore ya que para hacerlo se debe leer una gran cantidad de texto (opcional) para enterarte. Los personajes son entrañables y te encariñas facilmente con ellos.
Divertido para pasar el tiempo.
Recomiendo jugarlo con Dualshock4 | 高难度完全就是堆数值，cpu也是异常灵活，还有就是一周目结束了战斗前后的cg都没法跳过，每次战斗有一半时间在看重复的cg，每次游玩都是对心态的考验，后悔开坑。。 | Après avoir joué à Hades, je me devais de faire l'ensemble des jeux de Supergiant Games, et quelle régale que ce Pyre ! Bien qu'il soit un peu cours (une dizaine d'heures pour le finir pour ma part), il m'a transporté. Sa DA est a tombé par terre, ses personnages sont touchant et on se surprend à s'attacher à chacun d'entres eux, le gameplay est très sympathique, bien que peu présent en comparaison de la composante visual novel, mais c'est pour cela qu'on a signé ! Bref, si vous avez 10h à consacrer ces personnages qui ne vous laisseront pas indifférent, n'hésitez pas !

This game is really fun ...at first.

But then it's unintuitive "realistic" controls get in the way, the harder levels just aren't fun to play and the controls aren't fun to master. The assist options aren't quite good enough to compensate either. The slow down mechanic isn't usable when going for speed medals. The grab assist mode is just a bad targeting ai that points at the nearest grabable and often lands you in awkward positions. If the controls could be toggled from always relative to body position to relative to the game world, or even make it so just the arms/shoulders have this ability then it could be really good.

This game has so much potential and Walaber (the dev) has made a ton of great games. This just isn't one that I can recommend. | обалденная игра

一行无关紧的字没点就推动不了剧情 挺折磨的 你还得在你看过的地方重新找一边 然后一行一行字去点 没有一点提示或引导 玩到后期很容易卡关 不过剧情这点蛮不错看 剧情党可入 | 找线索找的我晕头转向的，不过剧情还有点意思 | Kinda liked the game, however it's hard to figure out what to do.. I've been stuck on some missions for hours. It comes eventually, but this game is truly a nice detective. Would recommend to people with big brains. XD | 题材不错，玩法设计有无可挽救的硬伤，每次卡进度都是因为没点一些无关紧要的边角料信息，而且当A材料与B材料同样提到了C事件时，会出现A材料中的信息可收集但B材料无法收集的情况，明明说的是同一件事啊喂。我虽然不是什么擅长玩解谜游戏的人，但你最起码让我有思考的沉浸感和快感吧？结果玩法上手之后就变成了公式化的操作，为了不漏掉可能的线索用鼠标一行字一行字地滑过去，大量精力都用来消化垃圾信息了，根本没有余力思考事件前后逻辑，我只是个臭打游戏的又不是刑警 | What the game sees as pertinent is sometimes innocuous,  while obvious evidence is not able to be  collected.  Pertinent text is not highlighted by default making gathering evidence tedious and unrewarding.  The game doesn't want you to think or solve any puzzles.  Gameplay boils down to searching for evidence in a very linear and unrewarding manner.   Most of the links in the search are blank.  This game lacks the world building you find in similar desktop detective titles/

While I appreciate the character DLCs, I don't really like the direction this game has taken for replayability. Having seasonal mechanics tacked on seems like the easy approach but doesn't add much to the overall game. They really should take the Dead Cells model with the stage scheming and add more branching zones and tilesets to make things feel fresh. Add more variety to the rooms per stage, like with the recent anxi desert change. Stick to one overarching mechanic that players can keep grinding on instead of adding seasonal ones that shift character useability and run approach every 4 months.

Subsequent updates also seem to be introducing some lag to the game. Tabbing out, even in singleplayer makes the game hang for a split second. Entering one room in multiplayer after someone else causes the game to hang at times. If the devs really do want to stick to the seasonal plan, then expand the skins to include the characters as well and make them limited to events! Soul essence is already a persistent currency that players can acquire with a grind. | I've sunk a few hundred hours into this game; once you grasp the connections between guns, abilities, and scrolls, it becomes  seriously addicting. I've played every season variation, and the way star link expands upon your character build is the most fun yet. I can easily justify $20 due to the amount of content it offers. | I didn't give this game much thought until I started playing it. The game is a well-made rogue-lite that's fun to play. The experience is even better with friends, up to three people, or you can find online matches.
I've highlighted 3 points that I think are important to mention:

Seasons
The season system is well-made. I've only played the last 2 seasons. At first, it's hard to understand the mechanics, but you get the hang of it over time. You just have to pay close attention to the readings, but they're very fun and varied. The season pass is free, easy and quick to get, and gives you beautiful and well-made cosmetics, which is a very positive point.

Replayability
I particularly enjoyed replaying the game. Putting on a playlist to listen to while playing is a pleasant experience. The game has many achievements and some of them require time and effort to complete, a huge variety of weapons to unlock, which gives a great feeling when you get a new weapon, in days when in any game you have to keep paying to get new things in the game (the game has 3 DLC with weapons, but the game also adds free weapons in each season).

Game modes
The game has few modes, only three, being the conventional mode, the main game mode where you have the stages and their difficulty to choose and challenge yourself and it is in this mode that you unlock most of the weapons and achievements in the game. The daily challenge mode, nothing special, the name already says what it is, a mode with a modifier that changes daily, just to get some achievements and challenge yourself. And the last mode, the horde mode, is a mode where you can equip some improvements to your characters and fight against large hordes of enemies that get harder and harder over time, but it has a final boss, so the hordes end. It's fun, but it only has two maps so far, and it ends up being repetitive.

My final thoughts are that the game is worth it for those who like games of this style, it's very different and diverse from the others. For the base game I think the price is worth it, but for the DLC I think it's worth waiting for a sale.

Enjoy and feedback! :) | Eu queria muito dar uma tryhardada em Gunfire Reborn, mas estava meio complicado de jogar sozinho. Então, surgiu uma promoção de conteudo adicional do game e resolvi comprar uma das 3 DLC's do jogo.
E rapaziada... de longe foi a melhor coisa que eu ja fiz!!! ^^ 

Gunfire Reborn é um game Roguelike/Roguelite, FPS, com leves elementos de RPG. Existem 12 personagens jogavéis que são bicinhos bem fofinhos (não sei se chega a ser furry), em que todos possuem 2 habilidades unicas e especiais, dando uma pegada de que cada run seja realmente diferenciada e unica. 6 são free, onde você desbloqueia apenas jogando, e os outros 6 são de dlc's. 

O jogo possui bastante coisa legal, como uma variedade boa de armas, inimigos, pergaminhos para buildar e uma arvore de talentos bacana até.
Durante a play, você vai se deparar com 3 steps até o final. É como se fosse o começo, meio e fim, bem padrão!! E em cada stage diferente, existe a possibilidade de vir 2 tipos de chefes. É sempre sortido, nunca da pra saber ao certo quem vai vir. 

Agora, como eu disse la em cima, no começo era realmente f0da de jogar sozinho. Eu até tive a cara de pau de sair chamando usuarios aqui da Steam pra jogar junto a mim, mas foi tudo em vão, infelizmente kkkkkkkk. Masssss, acabei descobrindo que da pra colocar bots [IA] pra ajudar e facilitar a gameplay!!! E isso foi extremamente util. *-* 
Eles até atacam, mas no geral são bem ignorantes KKKKKKKKKK, o que de fato eles são bons é em te levantar quando você é derrubado por algum monstro, assim evitando que sua jornada seja finalizada precocemente!!!!! 

Os graficos até que são decentes. Os mapas e cenarios são bem variados! Alguns são curtos e outros extensos. A arte do jogo é legal e a trilha sonora é meio chatinha mas da pra se acostumar.
Uma coisa que eu não curti muito foi que pra jogar no controle é meio ruimzinho. Eu sugiro muito que se você puder, jogue com um mouse & teclado. No joystick da pra brinca de boa, mas vai por mim e confia no que eu to falando!!!!!!!!!! Outro ponto também é a fisica e movimentação dos bonecos. É tudo muito duro, meio travado! Parece que os bichos tão com 500kg de concreto nas roupas huehuehuehuehue. 
Mas enfim... creio eu que isso seja proposital do jogo mesmo. Até porque tem itens que te dão um pouqinho a mais de velocidade. 

E pra encerrar, se você quer muito jogar sofrendo o minimo possivel eu recomendo duas coisas: a primeira é que jogue com amigos e conhecidos!!!! Vai ser bemmmmmmm mais "suave" a caminhada de todos até ficarem full broken. E a segunda é, caso for jogatinar sozinho, compre a DLC chamada Artisan and Magician. Vai por mim, de longe este conteudo adicional é DISPARADO o melhor de todos. Ela possui uma personagem bem OP que vai melhorar bastante o seu early game. 

E é isso aew galera. Sem sombra de duvidas recomendo simmmmmmmmmm Gunfire Reborn a todo mundo!!!!!!!!!!! Muito obrigado a você que chegou até aqui, um forte abraço e nos vemos nas proximas analises. Até la, bjbjbjbj e fuyyyyyyyyyyyy :* õ/

Love the concept and art style, but it doesn't have much depth. I want to keep playing, but there's nothing to unlock or work towards. | The game is way, way, way too short and simple at the price point. -Fun fell off for me after a dozen successful runs | I was really hoping for a longer experience in this game. Sure its hard when you start, but once you get the hang of it - it loses replayability as theres little variety of class types in the game. After beating the solo part of the game you get to play the "ranked" part of the game which isnt exactly fun.

Everhood is one of my new favorite RPGs. This is a game that wants to offer you a new experience—and it delivers!

Everhood is an existential, musical-psychedelic game where battles take place on a bullet-hell rhythm track. On the surface, it seems like an Undertale-like, but only in the same sense that Undertale is an Earthbound-like. As the player, you control a wooden doll who resembles Geno. At the beginning of the game, your arm is stolen, and you are sent on a quest to retrieve it... but it is not so simple.

The battles in Everhood are my favorite part of the game. The simple concept of dodging notes on a rhythm track is built upon and constantly remixed during the experience. The battles are choreographed to music (which is great), as one would expect from a rhythm-based game. You will particularly enjoy the music if you are into bass. Certain battles can become quite psychedelic and distorted, as though time, purpose (“why are you here?”), and the whole universe are dilating—fitting the theme of 'immortality' and giving the player a radical experience.

Everhood’s plot is interesting, though difficult to understand. Sadly, because Everhood is shorter than it needs to be, we do not learn much about the characters. The player is also not given enough time to grow attached to them, lessening the impact of emotional beats in Everhood’s late-game. The same applies to the world-building—many players might finish Everhood feeling confused, as information is given in bits and pieces. My last complaint is that a certain choice in the game is shoehorned as the 'correct' choice, but it can only be weakly justified in retrospect. These are my only issues with the game (it is too short!).

For players who want a challenge or to experience more gameplay, you can find alternate endings with difficult boss fights. One of the bosses was so tough that I ended up lowering my difficulty settings. For experienced gamers who want an extra challenge, you can, of course, crank the difficulty up. As of right now, I am tempted to replay Everhood to achieve the no-hit achievements and experience the game all over again. The brevity of Everhood can be a positive, in that the replay value is quite high.

Everhood was a very memorable experience. You may even feel like jumping back into it after you complete it!
8.5/10 (Great++) | Excelente experiencia, 10/10 recomendada
En general el juego toma muchas referencias a la cultura Geek Otaku e incluso de dragones y masmorras

Y si tienes tienmpo de reflexionar lee con atención las Grandes verdades que te van a contar vale la pena pensar un poco en ellas | Uma jornada sobre momentos divinos indescritíveis, revelando um mundo misterioso e que pede para o jogador entrar de cabeça nessa aventura. Dance around a Guitar Hero track to get your arm back, then use your arm to... save the world, I guess? Yes, let's go with that.

[h1][b]前後左右、一寸先は殺人ディスク。
隙間に飛び込み生き残れ。[/b][/h1]

テキスト無しのコミック的導入から始まるゲーム。
細かい説明はほとんどナシ。

ひたすらにディスクを避けながら
部屋に設定されている条件をクリアして進もう。


[h1]📀ルームの解放条件（クリア条件）とは[/h1]
条件は[b]『一定時間生き残る』[/b]が基本となっている。
だいたいが10秒～30秒程度となっており、
難易度もそれ相応に設定されている。

[b]全実績解除を目指す[/b]となると
[b]すべての部屋で20秒生存[/b]の必要があるため
ちょっと心持ちが変わってくるかも。

『殆ど無理ゲーやろこれ』ってのもあった。
でも何度か挑戦してたら偶然いけた。

加えて、部屋の解放条件の一部には
[b]何種類のディスクで死亡したか[/b]も関わっている。
なんと避けるべきディスクは１種類だけじゃないのだ。


[h1]📀殺人ディスクにも種類がある[/h1]
殺人ディスクには様々なバリエーションがあり、
これがゲームの主なギミックとなっている。

ただ真っ直ぐに飛んでくるもの。
初めはゆっくりだが、突然襲い掛かってくるもの。
一定時間経つと分裂するもの。
バリアを張っており近づくことができないもの。

それぞれのギミックを理解することこそ
長時間生存のための一歩なのである。

ボスステージのようなものもあり、
金の玉を回収することでダメージを与えられる
というギミックでちょっと楽しい。

……[b]等速直線運動[/b]っていいよな。
……[b]等速直線運動[/b]こそ正義だよ。
それ以外はホンマクソ。


[h1]📀ちょっとした謎解きステージも[/h1]
ただディスクを避けるだけではなく
[b]特別な行動をしなければ開始しない[/b]ステージもある。

ほとんどヒントは無いようなものなので
直感で分からなければガイドを見てもいいかも。

[b]入った時に明らかに雰囲気が違う[/b]ので
どの部屋がそうなのかは分かりやすい。


『たまにはシンプルな避けゲー遊びたいな』と
何も考えずに手に取った作品でしたが
思った以上に遊べて満足でした。
やっぱり[b]リトライ性が良い[/b]のが重要かな。

[b]設定でゲーム速度を調整できる[/b]のも良ポイント。

[b]最大で20％までディスク（と自分の速度）を遅くできる[/b]。
公式チートのようなものだが実績解除はこの状態でも可。
特にプライドが邪魔しないのであれば遠慮なく使おう。

というわけで、ギリギリの状態が好きな人におススメ。 | A really fun and entertaining game, it is really short but I recommend it, awesome game when you come home from school and you're bored and don't know what to do to pass some time. | Worth it on sale for 50% off or more, but $15 is a crime for a game you can 100% in 5 hours. | Absolutely infuriating yet addicting, but a great way to pass time and work on your keyboard speed lol | Jogo lixo nunca mais jogo essa merda. não vale um centavo nem na promoção. fique longe! >:(

Game Name: There Is No Game: Wrong Dimension
Reviews:
[h1]《There Is No Game: Wrong Dimension》——一场浪漫的数字冒险[/h1]  

[u]“这里没有游戏。”真的吗？[/u]  
你有没有玩过一款游戏，一上来就死命告诉你：[b]“这里没有游戏”[/b]？还一本正经地劝你关掉应用去干点别的？《There Is No Game: Wrong Dimension》（以下简称T.I.N.G）就是这样一个[b]“假装自己不是游戏”[/b]的游戏，而你，很快就会发现自己被骗得心甘情愿。  

这不仅是一款游戏，它更像是一封来自开发者的情书——[i]献给游戏、献给玩家、献给那个依旧相信游戏能带来魔法的自己。[/i]  

[hr][/hr]  

[h1]浪漫的游戏，不止于玩法[/h1]  
在讨论玩法之前，我想先聊聊这个游戏带给我的感受：它[b]浪漫得不可思议。[/b]  
这里的浪漫，不是指玫瑰花和情人节，而是一种对创作的纯粹热爱，一种愿意倾注心血去[b]打破常规[/b]的坚持。  

T.I.N.G 不只是游戏，它是开发者[b]Pascal Cammisotto[/b] 用代码写下的情感表达。它用一种极具个人风格的方式，打破了我们对游戏的固有认知，让玩家不只是“通关”，而是在[i]体验、在对话、在共同创造。[/i]  

[hr][/hr]  

[h1]配音、对白与“活着的游戏”[/h1]  
如果你喜欢幽默、喜欢游戏玩梗、喜欢自嘲的风格，那这款游戏一定会让你[b]笑出声。[/b]  
整个过程中，最核心的“角色”——[b]旁白[/b]，几乎就是开发者本人的化身。他既是游戏的“灵魂”，也是你的“对手”，不断与你斗嘴、打破第四面墙、讽刺游戏业界的各种套路。  

[quote=旁白] “游戏里怎么可能有Bug？” [/quote]  
[quote=旁白] “免费游戏？哈哈，你以为真的免费？” [/quote]  
[quote=旁白] “勇者救公主？请你来点新意好吗？” [/quote]  

他会时不时嘲讽玩家的操作，又会在你卡关时稍稍透露一些线索。整个过程，像是在和一个幽默又有点傲娇的朋友对话。[i]这种做法，让T.I.N.G 有了一种“活着”的感觉。[/i]  

[hr][/hr]  

[h1]游戏的玩法？是“拆解”规则的过程[/h1]  
T.I.N.G 的玩法很难用传统分类方式去描述，它[b]既不是纯解谜，也不是纯点击冒险，而是一个不断打破自己规则的体验。[/b]  

[list]  
[*] 当游戏告诉你“这里没有游戏”，你要试图找到游戏的“缝隙”，看看能不能让它露出破绽；  
[*] 当按钮坏掉，你得想办法“修理”它，但也许修理的方式是[b]故意把它弄坏[/b]；  
[*] 当屏幕被锁住，你要做的可能是调节音量、晃动窗口、甚至调整自己的鼠标灵敏度……  
[/list]  

这种玩法带来的满足感，是一种“和开发者对话”的感觉——[i]像是你们在进行一场超越时间和空间的互动。[/i]  
[quote=开发者] “想玩游戏？不可能的！” [/quote]  
[quote=玩家] “好，那我就偏要找到能玩的部分。” [/quote]  

[hr][/hr]  

[h1]从2D到VR，从像素到3D，每个维度都有惊喜[/h1]  
T.I.N.G 还特别有意思的一点是——它[b]并不仅限于一个美术风格，而是不断切换“游戏维度”。[/b]  

[olist]  
[*] 你会进入一个[b]像素风的复古冒险游戏世界[/b]，体验传统RPG的荒诞感；  
[*] 你会来到一个[b]90年代的点击式解谜游戏场景[/b]，寻找线索破解谜题；  
[*] 甚至，你还会进入一个[b]类似VR的立体界面[/b]，感受空间感的变化……  
[/olist]  

[b]到底什么才是游戏？[/b]  
是画面？是玩法？是交互？还是，我们和它建立的那份联系？  

[hr][/hr]  

[h1]这款游戏，为什么能触动游戏开发者？[/h1]  
作为一个曾经的游戏策划，我在这个游戏里感受到了一种特别的共鸣。  

[i]我仿佛能看到开发者在某个深夜，面对着屏幕闪烁的代码，一边喝着咖啡一边苦笑，想着“玩家们真的会理解我在做什么吗？”[/i]  
[i]我能想象他敲下“这里没有游戏”这行字时，嘴角带着一丝恶作剧般的微笑，却又怀揣着满满的期待。[/i]  

因为我们都知道，做游戏[b]不是为了让玩家“过关”[/b]——我们想做的，是创造一种体验，让玩家可以真正[i]感受[/i]到什么。  

T.I.N.G 就是这样一个游戏。它不只是娱乐，更是一场开发者与玩家之间的交流，是对[b]“游戏”这一媒介的一次思考和探索。[/b]  

[hr][/hr]  

[h1]结语：这不仅仅是一款游戏，它是一种情感表达[/h1]  
T.I.N.G 不是一款传统意义上的解谜游戏，它是一场体验，一场打破第四面墙、挑战玩家认知的旅程。  

[b]它浪漫，[/b]是因为它把游戏当成了一种表达，而不是一个单纯的产品。  
[b]它浪漫，[/b]是因为它不讨好市场，而是忠于创作者的初心。  
[b]它浪漫，[/b]是因为它让我们意识到，游戏不仅仅是程序和代码，它可以拥有灵魂，可以成为人与人之间的桥梁。  

如果你喜欢充满创意、幽默风趣、能够挑战思维定式的游戏——[b]别再犹豫，去体验这场浪漫的“非游戏”吧。[/b] | ✅ Uma história super interessante, engraçada e emotiva
✅ Dublagem incrível
✅ Design lindo
✅ Trilha sonora da GiGi é marcante demais
✅ Recomendo qualquer um a experimentar
✅ Jogabilidade simples porém intuitiva demais
✅ Puzzles sensacionais
❌ Não tem nada negativo

The combat early on seems pointless as you can be surrounded by 20 mobs and take no damage. The graphics in the game are quirky with a ton of lighting issues making the game look awful most of the time. The user interface is horrid with overlays overlaying other overlays upon more overlays... it's a mess visually. Why would I want to get notified of other players failing crafting when I am just starting the game? It's a UX/UI designers nightmare. Early story and quests are meh. If I were to summarize my new experience, I wouldn't say it was "bad", I would say it's "a turn off". | Black Desert Online has one of the best early and mid-game experiences. Progress feels rewarding, the world is vast and fun to explore, and there's a real sense of discovery. However, the late game is a completely different story.

Once you hit the late-game grind, progression slows down dramatically, taking anywhere from 20 to 100 hours just to see any improvement. Season characters are a great addition, but they also remove the early game entirely by handing out free PEN gear, which can feel like skipping one of the best parts of the game.

The biggest issue is how demanding the late game is, both in time and money. The game leans heavily into pay-to-win mechanics—you can buy Crons, making enhancement much less painful for those willing to spend money. While Black Desert has an incredible combat system and PvP is amazing, there's just not enough meaningful PvP content in the open world.

Overall, Black Desert isn’t a terrible game, but the late-game grind and monetization model make it hard to recommend unless you're ready to sink an absurd amount of time (or money) into it.

Sehr befriedigendes brettspielartiges Strategieerlebnis. Mir gefällt besonders, dass es ein Aufbauspiel ohne militärische Komponente ist. Jede Art Planet hat "Rezepte", wie man ihn nutzen kann, wenn man ihn kolonisiert. Es geht darum, ein florierendes Netzwerk zwischen den Planeten aufzubauen. 

Dabei gibt's eine Vielzahl von Problemen zu managen: Am Anfang fragt man sich, lieber schnell etwas zum Laufen bringen, um frühes Geld zu verdienen oder lieber erst die ganze Umgebung entdecken, um die Konstellationen zu optimieren? Im mittleren Spiel sollte man neben den klassischen Strategie-Dilemmas (zuerst Wirtschaft ausbauen oder Forschung?) immer auch die bestehende Infrastruktur im Blick haben - oft entstehen im Spielverlauf noch Möglichkeiten zur Verbesserung. Und gegen Spielende willst Du immer mehr expandieren, aber ab einer gewissen Anzahl Planeten wird alles exorbitant teuer. 

Hohe Varianz durch die Auswahl der Völker beim Spielstart. Die Völker haben eine klare Identität (auf welche Spielmechaniken und Spielstile sie sich beziehen), aber in jeder Partie bieten sie eine andere Auswahl an Technologien aus ihrem Pool an. Dadurch spielen sich die Partien vom Anfang bis Schluss sehr unterschiedlich.
Im Standardmodus gibt es zusätzlich noch "Modifikatoren", die die Eigenschaften der Karte verändern, auf der man spielt. Die sollte man für die ersten Runden erstmal ausschalten, weil das Grundspiel schon abwechslungsreich genug ist. Wenn man das Spiel besser kennt, sind sie sicher eine willkommene Abwechslung.
Es gibt auch eine Kampagne mit etwas mehr Story, aber ich finde den Standardmodus eigentlich genau richtig! | It's fun. I like it. It's the sort of space-based resource management game that appeals to my brain. Getting things to work is very satisfying! Not having that ONE RESOURCE you need within range is VERY FRUSTRATING! It's a good game to start up when you want to play SOMETHING and aren't sure what. Standard runs are pretty quick. There's still plenty of the game that I haven't interacted with, yet, at 10 hours in. If it looks like the sort of thing you would also like, I highly recommend it. | Love it!
Much more a puzzle than a 4X game.
Interesting mechanics, high replay value.
I absolutely recommend it.
Scalable UI makes it perfect for gaming on the Steam Deck.
(Search YouTube for better tutorials though.) | The game seems simple at first but optimizing for maximum efficiency is very tricky and satisfying to learn. Discovering all the interactions between mechanics has been very addicting and fun. Instantly one of my favorite games of all time. | Un bon jeu d'optimisation en environnement incertain. C'est paradoxalement un bon jeu de détente où le fait de se casser la tête n'a pas d'autre implication que d'avancer plus loin dans le temps et d'avoir un meilleur score. 
But du jeu: coloniser des planètes pour obtenir des ressources, qui elles-même demandent des ressources. Il faudra donc explorer votre espace, coloniser des planètes, puis les relier entre elles (sans croisement, d'où la difficulté). Un fois établie, de nouvelles ressources sont demandées, etc.
Le retour dans le temps permet aussi de faire des tests si on est pas sûr à 100% de notre coup, ou si on fait une erreur (attention cependant, il n'est valable que si les inconnues le reste, donc pas d'exploration). Les parties sont assez courtes (entre 1 et 2 heures selon votre réflexion), et la rejouabilité assez énorme (entre les bonus de races, les technologies, les types de systèmes et les anomalies si on les actives, on a de quoi faire).

En bref, un bon jeu de réflexion (d'optimisation) qui vous fera perdre la notion du temps.

Amazing story, interesting resourcce managment system. I liked it even more than frostpunk! | After watching The Terror season 1 way too many times and having this game on my wishlist forever, I finally decided to buy it. It does not disappoint to get that dreadful cold, environmental feel when playing it. Getting stuck in the ice where the world is trying to kill you.

It is a great story, survival-management game where you have to balance several things at once. The survival basics of heat, food, and the health and morale (decorum in this case) of your crew. On top of this, you also need to balance the loyalty of the certain members of the crew for certain end-game events and endings. Your choices will matter as it will affect the loyalty of your crew, certain events may arise throughout the story based on your actions or inaction (pay attention to what your crew tells you), and of course it will affect your endings.

It has plenty of replayability with different endings and achievements to go after. I would say your first playthrough will last around ten hours, but once you know how things work and what lies ahead after playing it once, you could probably breeze through most of the game to get to certain endings and get achievements if that is what you are after.

Definitely worth a buy and at least one playthrough! | Хорошо написанная визуальная новелла с элементами управления лагерем в качестве геймплея. Прошел сначала так, чтобы команда выжила, потом почитал концовки и там оказывается еще куча мистики в этой пещере )) | 好玩，故事很精彩，就是最后一点点的结局稍微有点平淡。

1. 船底仓的营地升级非常重要，个人认为最重要的营地升级有“工程工具” + “香料盒子”
工程工具能让一位工程师解决2个冻伤，基于此，可以极大减少燃料供应，几乎免费治疗冻伤。
（注：冰上极寒时食物需求不会提高，但是燃料需求会翻倍）
香料盒子更是食物永动机。香料盒子的效果是：在食堂大锅添加食物后，每有一个营养不良/坏血症患者，免费获得+3食物。
（食物越少，营养不良越多，营养不良越多，食物越多，所以食物越少，食物越多）。
（配合鱼，和变质口粮罐头，可以主动获得营养不良患者，前期就能白嫖食物，非常好用）

当然，如果在困难模式，以上的强力buff都会消失。变为食物、燃料+上限，这就不是特别重要了。此时重要的buff为
医疗工具：病房容量+1，非常好用
栓动式步枪：大型猎物+1。大型猎物最大狩猎成员组2人，狩猎两个猎物，所以栓动式步枪相较于左轮手枪和狩猎霰弹枪，产出比更高。 | It's good
