Kojima's first independent experience. 2015, [b]Kojima left Konami[/b] after MGSV. They didn't even let him accept the award he very deserved so. For the first time in years, there was no work ahead of him. No office, workers, computers, or resources; the man lost everything. 30 years in the industry, but no chance. Banks? Didn't trust him. Publishers? They didn't understand. Even his own family was against his idea, but if he going to continue creating unique experiences, it has to be on his own terms. He already had an idea that he was compelled to.

A studio that produce AAA games doesn't come in cheap, and Kojima didn't wanted to settle for less. [i]We know you're renowned, but you don't have actual results. [/i]It took him a little while to find a banker that's a fan and trust his vision for a loan. With the studio formed, with a logo that thrown on a paper - because they didn't had any computers - Kojima started to contact with western publishers. [i]You are crazy. [/i]What they told to him, because there was no pitch.

[b]You might think it's crazy too, I won't judge. But hear me out and be honest, Death Stranding is out for years and we know how the game is. If you were an investor, and some guy rushed in your office to pitch you a game where the main emphasis is connecting people together while delivering cargo, would you gave him the green light? I don't think so.[/b]

Despite all the circumstances, out of all game studios out there, there was one studio that was interested with the journey to independence of Kojima, despite being one of the largest game company out there. They understand he didn't want his creative vision to be touched with. A studio that known for getting smaller studios beneath them to create games that exclusive to their systems. But despite their authoritarian and strict policies, they didn't hesitate once when Kojima asked for help, and they basically gave him an empty check for him to pursue his dream.

[b]On December 16th, 2015; a day after Kojima's contract with Konami has been officially ended, Kojima Productions has been officially announced alongside with a strong partnership from Sony.[/b] 

He didn't had a studio to work with, because landlords didn't felt to settle with a company that didn't even produced anything yet. So he's settled for a room he was able to borrow from a friend and turned it into an office for himself and his three team members. He kept his independent endeavour a secret from his family, until the success that he was looking very forward to. But unfortunately, [b]his mother passed away during development.[/b]

He was just 13 when his father passed away, so his mother was a single parent that struggled to see the end of the day. Hideo, being very protective of her, stopped pursuing his dreams after finishing high school, and studied economics to be safe - a choice that satisfied everyone except himself.[b] But he never stopped dreaming.  [/b]He satisfied his active imagination through other forms of entertainment, His parents, encouraged his interest in movies; they would sit Hideo down to watch a movie together, and discuss the themes and direction with him. He was lonely and isolated and he still carries it to this day, and television was only thing to let him cope out of this.

[i]What helped me get through that period were movies and books. This was when I discovered the power contained in entertainment  and stories. I decided that when I grew up, I wanted to work in a job that would allow me to create these kinds of stories. [/i]He was determined to become either a film director or a novelist. Unfortunately, at that time, these seen as [b]significant risk.[/b] After his father's passing, financial concerns became unavoidable, adding to the mental burden his mother carried as a single parent.

When he first encountered video games, he realized they could offer a new way to create film-like experiences. The potential of this emerging medium was undeniable to him, ultimately steering him toward a career in the gaming industry rather than filmmaking. However, with the market oversaturated, publishers losing control, and competition among home consoles intensifying, the video game industry crash of 1983 unfolded. His friends and professors thought he was out of his mind and urged him to reconsider. 

[i]It was only my mother who told me that I could do whatever I wanted to in life. She was the only one. The ghosts in the game — maybe my parents are one of them, seeing me in this world. I wanted  to have that kind of metaphor, that within you, you’re connected to the people that passed away.[/i]

Hideo opted for an existing engine to avoid extending development by months or years. Seeking the right fit, after visiting several studios, they arrived at [b]Guerrilla Games[/b] to assess the [b]Decima Engine[/b]. Impressed by the team, Hideo was deeply moved when managing director gifted him a wooden box containing [b]Decima’s full source code—no contract, just pure support.[/b] 

[i]I always feel lonely in society. There are so many people who play games feeling like that, like they  don’t belong in this society. They don’t really feel comfortable. You’re all alone playing the game. And you’re trying to connect this fractured society by yourself. The world is beautiful, but you’re small, just a tiny speck. You feel hopeless and helpless and powerless.[/i]

That deep sense of loneliness ties back to his childhood. Leaving Konami brought those memories rushing back, finding comfort in knowing others, even fictional ones, felt the same. He wanted players to experience that feeling, inspiring Death Stranding’s online features, where they can see footprints, hear echoes, and leave helpful tools for others. Hideo’s childhood also inspired oceanic environments and massive sea creatures. His father pushed him out to sea in a boat—a terrifying memory that stayed with him. Another key influence came in 1970 when he attended the Osaka World Expo. For the first time, he saw people from different countries and witnessed a blend of ancient cultures and cutting-edge technology under the slogan [i]Progress and Harmony for Mankind.[/i] This vision of a future where technology unites humanity left a lasting impact on him.

While the internet had connected people like never before, he saw increasing fragmentation and isolation. He wanted to offer a more positive way to connect people—without competition or co-op combat. Instead, the game’s online component would focus on helping unseen players work toward a shared goal, a concept that became the [b]Social Strand System. [/b]

His team was skeptical. They pushed back. [i]But no one plays games to help others. Players want to stand out, to be the strongest. [/i]He wasn’t surprised. [i]A new concept is always hard to explain. Even with stealth games, my first opponents were my own team. [/i]Their doubts grew when they learned the gameplay centred on delivering packages and reconnecting a desolate world. Traversal mechanics would add depth, but no one grasped his vision. Frustration mounted as they kept asking, [i]Where are the guns? Where’s the combat?[/i]

[b][i]No. This is about something different. It’s about walking and experiencing the world.[/i][/b] | Death Stranding: Director’s Cut is one of the most unique game I’ve ever played, but I won’t lie the first few hours it really test your patience. You’ll probably feel like uninstalling it, but trust me, stick with it. Once you get into the story, it’s a whole different gravy. You play as Sam Porter Bridges, delivering packages across a post apocalyptic world to reconnect humanity. Sounds simple, but between dodging creepy BTs, dealing with wild weather, and managing your cargo, it gets intense. The visuals are stunning, the music playlist is just fire, and the story? Deep, very emotional, and super weird in the best way. If you’re patient and down for something different, this game is an experience you won’t forget. Stick with it it’s worth it. | Sadly, the OG Death Stranding has been fully replaced with Directors Cut, I have over 100 hours in the OG. Just like most people I had bandwagon on the concept of the game when it was announced, Uber Eats delivery guy at the volcano, Norman biker man, monster energy and the tube baby. Silly Kojima I thought. I had then eventually bought the game for the PS4 but shelved it after about 2 hours of play. I would say I was not in the right head space and mood for the game, it was not grabbing me. As I shelved I had thought again, silly Kojima.

After it was released on the PC market, I had grabbed it again and thought once more, silly Kojima, sure I will try your game again. Oh boy, was I hooked. Yes the concept is a bit silly, some times even nonsensical, but it didn't matter. The gameplay and the progression really is the hooking part. Who knew that a delivery game had me do work when I came home from work.

The managing of items and how you delivery them was a fun part, sorting out and building yourself for the optimal approach to getting your delivery done. It was until I had the truck then it just became Mud Runner to Snow Runner gameplay. I defiantly felt like a mailman in my world, I would get into the game and just put on a podcast and off I went into the hostile world.

I think the genius comes from the multiplayer aspect of the game. In the world you are alone but its counter balanced by when your vehicle is running out of juice and you see in the distance a charging pole, left there by a player. That's what the multiplayer mechanics are, useful structures being left by players and to aid a delivery man by a delivery man. The lonely world doesn't feel so lonely after all. The game tracks footpaths from most players and starts to slowly create the path itself on the maps. Building roads, ramps, bridges, are all part of the fantastic multiplayer concept that plays with your world and theirs too. People leave "likes" as an indicator of thanking you or thanking them back. This also goes for the system of lost cargo, players like me in the early game have lost cargo, but other players cargo can appear in your world and you can collect it and return it to them. This is also upgraded by a donation system, where in main hub areas people leave gear for other players to access. I have yet to see a game so far expand on this great multiplayer formula that ties itself for your world.

There are so many aspects of the game I can keep talking about it, the route planning of your cargo, the combat, the many tools you use to get around obstacles, the varies amount of structures such as the slingshots which make traversing the maps super fast, but this is exactly what makes this an amazing game, however though a word of caution is how well would it stand once the player base is lacking to create those elements. I think that's the one major problem with the game is that all these elements and gameplay are crucially connected to the world with everyone else but if player base is lacking, would the person still get the same experience that I had when the player base was thriving. Hard to say, maybe they would implement some system to integrate just fake players.

The story for itself is also crucial, some game journalist expressed the cringe or child like elements of the game, I disagree. I wont touch on anything as the story was also part of the experience of the game, great characters and a good story overall as you piece it together. If you like Kojima stuff, then you will have no issues here.

I think the cherry on top of the whole thing was extra details added to the game, like Mads Mikkelsen in game saying happy birthday to me. :) | 영화 같은 게임이지만 이런 류 게임 중에선 특이점이라 부를만한 게임

영화 같은 게임에서 가장 중요한 건 스토리인데 이 게임은 스토리는 진짜 개씹노잼인데 게임플레이가 존나 꿀잼이라 커버가 되는 이상한 게임이다.

초반 파트는 컷신도 존나 많고 배달도 ㅈ같고 뭐하는 겜인지 감도 안 잡혀서 환불 마려운데,

동부 지방을 지나서 진짜 게임이라고 부를 수 있는 중부지방으로 오는 순간부터 진짜 게임 시작이다.

이때부터 배달이 재밌어지기 시작하며 배달에 대한 정당한 보상을 주기 시작한다.

그리고 이 게임의 알파이자 오메가인 국도 건설.

이 놈의 국도를 건설하면 10분은 걸어서 배달해야 할 거리를 30초만에 차 타고 갈 수 있게 되니 사람이라면 이걸 건설하고 싶어지는 건 당연한 욕망이다.

웃긴 건 길을 짓는 게 생각보다 까다로워서 국도 하나 당 한 시간은 기본으로 잡아야한다.

하지만 걱정할 필요 없다.

누가 시켜서 하는 것도 아니고 배달 좀 빠르게 해보겠다고 국도 지을 정도까지 왔으면 이제 이 게임이 재미있어졌을 거니까.

이 시기쯤부터는 하라는 스토리는 안 하고 국도건설에 집라인 건설만 주구장창해서 이동의 자유를 추구하게 되니 진짜 스스로 할 일을 찾아서 하는 오픈월드라는 것이 무엇인지 알 수 있게 된다.

하지만 앞에서 말했다시피 이 게임의 단점은 스토리.

스토리 재밌다는 사람도 있긴 한데 전형적인 코지마 식 게임이라 정보는 존나게 많은데 쓸모있는 정보는 하나도 없다. 

하여간 정가주고 살만한 게임이냐고 하면 애매한데 게임불감증와서 할 게임이 없으면 이 게임은 무조건 사서 해야 한다.

나는 살면서 수많은 게임을 했지만 데스 스트랜딩이랑 비슷한 게임을 본 적도 없고 해본 적도 없다.

겜창이라면  무조건 해야할 유니크한 게임이다 | Death Stranding n’est pas un simple jeu vidéo. C’est une œuvre hybride, à mi-chemin entre le jeu d’aventure, la simulation et la réflexion philosophique, née de la vision unique d’Hideo Kojima. Ici, tout est question de connexion : reconnecter un monde brisé, créer des ponts entre les personnages et, surtout, entre le joueur et cette expérience singulière.

Vous incarnez Sam Porter Bridges, un livreur chargé de traverser un monde post-apocalyptique pour livrer des colis tout en recréant des liens entre les colonies isolées. Chaque livraison est un voyage, où chaque pas compte. Contrairement aux jeux où l’action prime, Death Stranding vous pousse à planifier minutieusement vos déplacements, à anticiper les obstacles et à gérer le poids de votre charge. La satisfaction ne vient pas de combats épiques, mais d’accomplissements personnels, comme atteindre une destination lointaine après une marche harassante.

Le gameplay repose sur une boucle unique : explorer, transporter et reconstruire. Le monde ouvert, vaste et désolé, est un protagoniste à part entière. Les paysages, inspirés de l’Islande, alternent entre une beauté sauvage et une hostilité palpable. Les dangers sont omniprésents, qu’il s’agisse des Échoués (des âmes perdues entre deux mondes), des MULEs (des pilleurs obsessionnels) ou des intempéries qui érodent vos ressources.

Les mécaniques de jeu sont exigeantes mais gratifiantes. Chaque équipement, de l’échelle à l’exosquelette, joue un rôle crucial, rendant chaque voyage stratégique et immersif. À cela s’ajoute une dimension sociale : les infrastructures construites par d’autres joueurs peuvent apparaître dans votre monde, créant un sentiment de coopération indirecte, mais profondément humain.

Narrativement, Death Stranding explore des thèmes universels : la solitude, la résilience face à l’adversité et l’importance des liens humains. Kojima tisse une histoire complexe et émotionnelle, portée par un casting exceptionnel (Norman Reedus, Mads Mikkelsen, Léa Seydoux). Les performances des acteurs, combinées à une réalisation cinématographique, donnent vie à des personnages attachants et mémorables.

La bande-son, signée Low Roar et d'autres artistes, est un chef-d’œuvre en soi. Elle accompagne parfaitement l’atmosphère contemplative du jeu, transformant de simples marches en moments d’introspection.

Death Stranding n’est pas pour tout le monde. Son rythme lent et ses mécaniques peu conventionnelles peuvent rebuter. Mais pour ceux prêts à s’immerger dans son univers, il offre une expérience inoubliable, où chaque livraison est une petite victoire et chaque pas une réflexion sur ce que signifie "reconnecter".

Un chef-d’œuvre pour les uns, une curiosité pour les autres. Une chose est sûre : Death Stranding ne laisse personne indifférent.

 | [h1]Классно но душно[/h1]
Первые 10 часов игра тебя радует, погружаешься, развиваешь бар, но как-только добираешься до русалидов начинается духота, миллион квестов для этих чертей, какие-то душные головоломки уровня третьего класса, в какой-то момент добавляется еще и симулятор фермера, когда ты задумываешься ну куда уже дальше, когда уже конец, добавляется еще и симулятор фермера водорослей, смешивания коктейлей и прочего, погружения и ловля рыбы перестают иметь смысл т.к денег слишком много, а сюжет искусственно затянут, если бы игра закончилась за 10-15 часов было бы идеально, но тут можно ковыряться все 30-40
Кривожoпaя боёвка с боссами отдельное раздражение, но игра всё равно довольно приятная и чилловая, хоть и по сути вводит тебя в заблуждение описанием. | Estupidamente incrível e a pura definição do que jogos são e deveriam ser nos dias de hoje.

Dave the Diver pode parecer repetitivo e sem conteúdo, mas é totalmente o contrário, toda vez que você pensa que não irá ter nada novo adiante, ele vai la e te entrega mais, bastante gameplay diferente durante o decorrer do jogo, cameos de outras franquias de jogos, referências e easter eggs magníficos.

Se você está a procura de um jogo que não seja caro e que entregue uma experiência completamente nova e empolgante, e também esteja cansado dessa geração genérica de AAAs, Dave the Diver foi feito pra você.

9,5/10 | Took a while for me to really get into it, but once I did, it was fantastic!

Pro's:
-Creativity
-It doesn't really get stale, because there is something new around every corner (a new game mechanic, a new area, a new part of the story)
-The humor
-it's fun to upgrade your restaurant, as well as your equipment. There is a good feeling of progression.
Because of that, things that are tricky at the start of the game, become much more doable, or even easy. And that's really great, because you feel that you've worked for it!
-The characters! Though it wouldn't have hurt if it had been a little bit less of a sausage fest. There are some female characters, but the main cast are male. Still, they were fun, memorable, and fit well into the story.
-The actual fishing! I loved coming across bigger, faster, stronger, more dangerous beasts of the sea, and besting them! It took a bit to really get the hang off, but once I did, it became so satisfying to dive every day and gather everything that I needed for the restaurant! Slowly unlocking and upgrading more dishes because I was able to catch different creatures. 
-Honestly, it just looks very nice! The colors are pleasant, the locations are pretty, the bosses are kinda cool, the character design is varied, I love that Dave is VERY much a plus size! He's just a lovable teddy bear. 


cons:
-There are some game mechanics that could have been left out? Especially at the end there are things that you need to keep up with that become more like a chore than something fun. But in my opinion, it's not terrible. You have the time, and it doesn't take that long, but still. It is a bit much to do everything.
-Dave in the water: Fantastic! Dave working in the restaurant.... incredibly slow. I know it's part of the game, but it is made worse when you have to poor drinks for customers.. Every time I had to pour a beer, or make a cocktail, I would dread it. And I had staff take over as quickly as I could.
-Some parts can be a little confusing at first, but once you get it, or get the hang of it, it's fine. It's mostly that there is a lot, and it can become overwhelming.


Would I recommend this game?
-To anyone that wants a semi-cozy (semi-stressful) gaming experience.
-If you like a roguelike, but would like a different take on it!
-You like fishies but arn't afraid to brutally shoot a harpoon into them (it's just a game. It's harsh but it's also comical. No actual fishies are harmed in you shooting a bunch of pixels. But people can be sensitive to stuff like this, and that's okay! Just keep this in mind before you buy!)
-You're ready to try something new!

So yes, in general I think this is a fantastic game! But it might not be for everyone (no game is) 
You can always watch some game play so you know what is ahead of you. If what you see seems fun, Go for it!!
If you are on the fence, I'd lean towards getting it anyway, because there is so much to this game, I'm sure there will be at least a few things that will positively surprise you if you are willing to put in the time! | Wonderful cute and fun game that has so much content to offer, great music, great visuals and art and tons of fun catching all the fish.
No Reviews

Good game. Sunk some hours into it.
But, and this is a personal opinion, the recent updates and changes to Gameplay ruined it. | 目前主要玩恶魔就算场上怪数量在三百以上也没有崩溃过（可能是还未打mod），就是有点卡顿，但这种情况下基本也都是中后期了，屏幕上也基本密密麻麻的都是兵，卡也还算正常。ai方面难度基本就是靠给ai资源优势了。这种像素风个人很喜欢，但后期调整部队（尤其是英雄间换单位）就只能靠文字操作了。实时战斗操作主要是在法术的释放上，微操能是能但还是比较麻烦的，一般非重要战斗基本不会微操，整体更加注重经营，英雄升级和兵种搭配等等大战略上的操作。总得来说个人而言还是一款不错的游戏，但购买还是需要看看能不能忍受游戏的一些特点
还有，这游戏好像联机是不能联机的（好像能连，但网上说联机比较麻烦）但能和全战模拟器一样在一台电脑玩排兵布阵，甚至能微操（有冷却时间），但要轮流拿同一个鼠标微操 | Fun game, best feature in any game is hot seat so I can play with the family on one computer. Great game for a relaxing game night. It has a lot of variety and replayability. | 1700打1600 我所有兵都卡死在原地被對面強度2的遠程慢慢射死

This game doesn't f around. These mother crabbers WILL beat your bass if you don't learn how to parry/shield/dodge effectively. Beginning can be daunting, but once you gain more abilities it becomes incredibly fun overall. | I don't often do reviews. This game's set pieces are amazing, the puns are amazing, the dialogue is amazing, the theme is amazing. Crabs-like is the greatest genre to exist, I love you Kril. | Peak. Somehow blends comedy and a earnest story together seamlessly without it ever becoming intrusive, while at the same time delivering a believable world with surprisingly subtle (relatively regarding most games heavy-handed approach in near any form of message) commentary of the threat of ocean pollution. It never stops you to grab the camera and shake it while screaming the intent it wants to put across, but just lets the setting speak for itself with the Dark Souls-ification of the sea bed and its inhabitants. Combat's simple, but fun; breezy to complete without needing much for cleanup. | 总的来说还是挺不错的，战斗系统很有特色，地图设计挺有水平

Story wise I was hooked, game-play premise wise I was excited, but this game misses on the most important beat: the music. I'd get gripped by the narrative in between songs, and then get ripped out of the moment by the clunky pacing and verbiage. I salute the effort here and can tell care was put in to this one, but an interactive musical needs to have better lyrical flow than this for me. | Stray Gods is a fresh and creative musical RPG, and it plays well on the Steam Deck.  

Pros: 
- Beautiful art and great voice acting.  
- Choices really matter, making the story feel personal.  
- Runs smoothly on the Steam Deck.  

Cons:
- Some scenes transition awkwardly.  
- A few slow parts in the story.  

Overall, it’s a unique and fun game, perfect for musical and story fans! | I have enjoyed playing through this. The voice acting is really well done, the songs can come across cheesy but by the end of going through all of the choices, I ended up really liking most of the music. My main (and really only) complaint is being unable to skip through the songs (especially after you've viewed them). I understand their importance, but once I did the two romances I was interested in, I did achievement cleanup and it took quite a long while. | Ein interaktives Musical??   Count me in!

Stray Gods war ein absolut fantastisches und Einzigartiges Erlebnis das sich nur schwer in Worte fassen lässt, darum lass ich es.
Nur Wisset dies: Nicht immer braucht ein spiel packende Action oder eine anspruchsvolle Story. Manchmal reicht es schon sich von bedeutungsvoller Musik treiben zu lassen und genau das hat dieses spiel bei mir geschafft. Mehrmals. | Gods, Music & Mystery

Stray Gods is something that I went into blind and I’m glad I did, enthralled by it's solemn & whimsy, it’s beautifully drawn depictions of Greek gods. Their stories are portrayed through the eyes of Grace, the protagonist caught up in a musical mystery to be unfolded by you and I loved getting to see each character arc blossom.

Genres: Action, Casual, Indie, RPG, Early Access
Reviews:
Очень долгие забеги и малое разнообразие, как минимум по началу. Основной контент содержится в другой версии(+18) именно этим я объясняю монотонный геймплей. Не советую есть игры лучше в данном жанре. | Juego con un corte muy similar a Vampire pero que combina waifus con las mecánicas tradicionales de una manera realmente divertida, si bien, está quizás demasiado sexualizado el aspecto de los personajes.

Avance lo suficientemente rápido como para no perder el interés y buen ritmo de progresión, utilizando muy bien la formula de recompensa/satisfacción.

After spending over 900 hours immersed in Darkest Dungeon 2, I can confidently say it is a challenging yet rewarding masterpiece. The game strikes a balance between punishing difficulty and the exhilaration that comes with overcoming it. If you're looking for a game that demands strategic thinking, and rewards adaptability, this is it.

Initially, I found the level of randomization in the game—particularly at launch—to be overwhelming. Too often, failure felt like the result of bad luck rather than poor decision-making. However, the developers have worked  to address this issue through a series of updates and balance changes, creating an experience where every loss feels like an opportunity to learn and grow. Today, success in Darkest Dungeon 2 is far more about your strategic choices, your understanding of the game mechanics, and your knowledge of enemy behavior. This shift has made victories feel even more gratifying and defeats less frustrating - most of the time :)

One of the most impressive aspects of the game is how it encourages experimentation.  Every team composition is now viable—a huge improvement from the early days when certain combinations felt sub-optimal. With a bit of understanding of game mechanics and enemy abilities, you can succeed with any group of characters, which has transformed Darkest Dungeon 2 into a sandbox of tactical possibilities.

The journey itself—navigating the game’s haunting, beautifully rendered landscapes—is unforgettable. Every step feels consequential, and every decision matters. Whether you’re managing your team’s stress levels, deciding which encounters to tackle, or weighing the risks of pushing your luck for better rewards, the game constantly challenges your ability to think ahead and adapt on the fly. The tension is relentless, but it’s this very pressure that makes every small victory feel monumental.

Another standout feature of Darkest Dungeon 2 is its community. The game’s fans are incredibly supportive, and the tight-knit nature of the player base fosters a sense of camaraderie that’s rare in today’s gaming landscape. Whether you’re looking for tips, sharing war stories, or just enjoying the creativity of small but dedicated content creators, there’s always something to engage with. The content creators, in particular, deserve praise for consistently producing entertaining and insightful material that enhances the overall experience.

In its current state, Darkest Dungeon 2 has become everything I hoped it would be and more. It’s a game that demands your respect, tests your resolve, and rewards your persistence. While it’s not for the faint of heart, for those willing to embrace its challenges, the payoff is unparalleled. Whether you’re a seasoned veteran or a newcomer, this is a journey worth taking—a journey into madness, perseverance, and triumph. Darkest Dungeon 2 isn’t just a game; it’s an experience, one I’m thrilled to recommend to anyone who dares to face its horrors. | [h1] YES, IT IS NOT DARKEST DUNGEON 1! [/h1]

However, this game deserves a way higher rating. It is fun, it is well made, it is unique experience.
Unfortunately its main game loop takes away several aspects that Darkest Dungeon 1 players enjoy so much.
This explains the sour ratings for an otherwise highly enjoyable game.

What is different:
Instead of slowly restoring your hamlet, your heroes travel the landscape with a stagecoach.
The expeditions are long and follow a roguelike gameloop. You can choose which regions to travel to and, like in many other roguelike/roguelite titles, select the next waypoint from a choice of 2 or 3 options.

Positives:
1. First off.. the greatest thing about it.. THE SOUNDTRACK. 
Stuart Chatwood filled this game with a bunch of absolute bangers: Sprawl Battle, Traverse the Mountain and Battle of the Mountain - these songs will put you on edge in epic decisive battles, where small mistakes will be even more punished than in the first iteration of the game. Sprawl Battle became my personal most heard song on Spotify.
2. The graphics are great. The pre-move animations add a lot of life and dynamic action in comparison to the more static first Darkest Dungeon. The winddown animations are just beautiful too.
3. The relationships between characters are a fantastic addition. Unluckily, it became a bit too easy to always get good relationships, which often makes the game a lot easier. Unluckily the powered up moves are random and sometimes just useless.
4. The boss fights can be hard if you bring the wrong team comp. To me, these harder fights are very enjoyable. Beating the boss with one man standing basically in the last swing was a very amazing and memorable experience.
5. The token system adds a bit more consistency in your battle plan. For most players, this might be an improvement. I personally enjoyed the randomness of the first part a little more.
6. The reflection shrines tell the stories of the heroes and are really cool.
7. The narrator (June Wayne) delivers once again and the lines slap hard. Yet, most lines feel less iconic than the first part.
8. Less micromanagement.

Negatives:

1. There is no gravitas when failing a run or when a characters dies. You don't lose them. You can just select them again in your next run. This bitter aspect of the first Darkest Dungeon is what made it so thrilling. Here you can basically end a run early with little consequences. Sometimes it is the best course of action to abandon midway and cut your losses.
2. Good team comps are limited. You can't play some goofy stuff anymore like 4 Lepers.
3. Decisions along the way have no impact. You decide on whatever resource you need most in the moment.
4. Many beloved characters are missing in the base game and are trickling in with DLCs. As things are progressing right now, getting the full DD1 roster in the future might cost you another 50-100 bucks.
5. Camping is replaced by the inn, which is less immersive. The fear of ambushes and the little moments of respite inside the dungeons was a great touch.
6. Spending a few hours just to get smacked by a boss or miniboss is pretty bitter. Yes, you can upgrade a bunch of stuff and it was not completely for naught. But the upgrades are whatever.
7. Many paths of the heroes are inferior to other paths and for me there is no reason to play semi-useless builds.
8. Some characters are strong and they play nicely (e.g. Highwayman and Man-At-Arms). Some characters are quite weak like the Runaway.

Conclusion:
It is not Darkest Dungeon 1. It is still a fantastic game. Some gameplay mechanics are better, some are worse.
The DLC money-squeeze is a bit of a turn-off. Especially hiding already designed characters behind a paywall is a huge no-no.

Addendum:
Redhooks EULA agreement is pretty dank: https://store.steampowered.com/eula/262060_eula_0 (Section 5, 14 and 20)
This is a singleplayer game. I am not speedrunning. Why do you want to monitor my RAM? | 红钩你真是个剑冢，单角色dlc42块，首发没折扣，还会炸存档。本来冲着情怀可以忍气吞声一下，这时候红钩来了，说：你们不要生气哦，新玩家109块能拿下本体和所有dlc哦。今天是除夕，我想狠狠地除外你们制作组的亲妈，一群背刺老玩家的出生。 | 纪念教授和老祖的配音演员，希望红钩后续更新能对得起配音演员的付出。 | If you are concerned about the negative reviews on this game, it is imperative you ignore every and all negative reviews comparing this game to Darkest Dungeon 1.

This game is not a "remake" of DD1. They didn't "take away features". Red Hook have made it abundantly clear that Darkest Dungeon 2 is it's own game and while it has the same art style and battle system of the first game (thus why it's called Darkest Dungeon 2 and not something else like other reviews say it should be) it should be viewed as it's own experience rather then compared to a almost totally different game.

I have hundreds of hours in both games and I love them both dearly for their own merits. If you prefer DD1's long campaign and are not a fan of DD2's rougelike confessions mode or the shorter campaign in kingdoms mode. That's totally fine! DD1 isn't going anywhere and you can go and play that right now. But just because you prefer how DD1 did things, it doesn't make DD2 a bad game. It just means you prefer DD1's gameplay loop. The last thing Red Hook wanted to do when making DD2 was make DD1 obsolete so they tried their hardest in not making Darkest Dungeon 2 just more of Darkest Dungeon 1. This is the key thing you need to realise when getting into DD2 when you're a long time DD1 player.

Sadly because of the recent negative reviews I felt like I needed to go on this long rant but I will quickly gush a little about this game for people who are completely new to the series and want to give this game a try.

Darkest Dungeon 2 is a wonderful experience I would strongly recommended to any turn based RPG fan, especially if you're looking for something a little tougher since this game does not pull any punches. The art style is beautiful gothic horror and despite the dreary look, the game's theme of hope is extremely uplifting and inspiring. It is all tied together by Wayne June's (R.I.P) excellent narration. Needless to say, I highly recommend giving this game a try. Good luck and remember that in each of us there is a hopeful light holding fast against the hellish shadows that gather between our good intentions.

A bullet heaven/Survivorslike game that is a beautifully crafted experience with a variety of character classes and several different game modes. Each character class has its own strengths and some offer very unique play styles. In typical roguelike fashion this game starts with quick runs that unlock new content regularly, and after a few hours of play you will be able to understand the different directions the game can go in and what you can spend your time doing. 

This is a great game at a great price that offers a lot of content and can keep you involved for many dozens of hours. | Otro Survivor, pero en este en lugar de armas invocas minions.

[b]20 Minutes Till Dawn[/b] захоплює, як і всі подібні рогалики, але не розважає. Принаймні мене. Повернутися до цієї гри хочеться приблизно так само, як до гри на телефоні, яку бачиш у черзі чи автобусі, щоб убити час.

[h3]Що не сподобалося:[/h3]
[b]Стріляти потрібно самому. [/b]Принаймні спочатку, поки не отримаєш магію. Я б хотів просто водити джойстиком, а стрільба щоб була автоматичною.

[b]Фіксовані життя. Наприклад, [/b]4 сердечка. Втратив їх — починаєш спочатку. Поповнити життя неможливо, окрім як при підвищенні рівня, обравши бонус.

[b]Нікуди бігти. [/b]У інших подібних іграх є мітки — йди в ту частину карти й отримай нагороду. Тут же просто 20 хвилин ходиш безцільно.

[b]Немає автозбору.[/b] Усі вибиті ресурси залишаються на карті. Можна відійти, а потім так і не знайти, де що було вибито.

[b]20 персонажів — усі жінки. [/b]Чому? У вас якісь проблеми з чоловічими персонажами? Сам герой на карті дуже маленький, часто можна розібрати лише волосся. Додайте хоча б вампіра, дварфа, гремліна чи лепрекона.

[b]Занадто темне зображення. [/b]Граю на Steam Deck. Бігає щось сантиметрове по темній карті. Це мені не подобається.

[b]Можна отримати шкоду від дерев.  [/b] Від них точно не очікуєш такого.

Для мене це мінуси, але для когось, можливо, плюси. Могли б українську додати. Хочеться закінчити коментар якимось матюком. :-) | Очень понравилась стилистика игры.

Okay, but honestly, I took like a long amount of month break and I don't know why, probably just started playing something else honestly...but when I came back I still knew the controls and the story of what I was doing and why I was doing it. Using AP to solve puzzles is very annoying though, wish there was like a "I guess" option for recommending XD  But that's my only gripe so I suppose "Yes" works here

Jusant is a generally good quality walking sim, but was unimpactful to me. The environments look nice and the animations were generally really good. You have the generic blob-like cute animal companion that makes the generic cute animal companion noises and has magic powers, and that kinda characterizes the game for me: nothing especially unique, but also doesn't falter anywhere obvious. The collectibles struck a good balance of out of the way, but not so hidden that you feel forced to use a guide to find them. My only major complaint was that the camera is terrible; it constantly locked me into looking at some specific part of geometry, which was extremely irritating when I was just trying to look at scenery. I would have also liked to see a bit more loose exploration. The first 4 chapters felt like there was exactly one way to climb and left little to explore and experiment with, but chapter 5 did a good job at loosening up and letting me try more things. Overall, while I am definitely not negative about the game, I just feel very meh; it had good environments and collectibles, but lacked any substance that would have helped me feel more strongly about it.

It took me about 5 hours to beat the game, then an additional 1.5 hours to 100% it (using an excellent chapter select that told me what collectibles were remaining in each stage). | I absolutely fell in love with this game, it is one of the most stunning visually i have ever played. I adore the world and the landscape. 
Climbing is also very dear to my heart, and the way this game captures the phisicality of it, the body language of the protagonist when climbing, and how natural and organic it all feels, is nothing short of insane. It made me want to pick up the sport again. 
I love, love, love this game. Chapter one is my favourite.
[spoiler]I just wish they'd let me climb the whole thing myself. Still love it[/spoiler] | This is a beautifully designed and cozy game that stands out with its charm. The graphics are lovely, with soft, hand-drawn visuals that evoke the warm feel of modern animated films. The music complements the experience nicely, playing subtly in the background to enhance key moments. However, it’s not the kind of soundtrack that lingers in your mind once the game is over. It’s more about setting the mood than creating memorable themes.

What truly sets this game apart, though, is the gameplay - particularly the climbing mechanics, which are by far the best I’ve ever experienced in any video game. The game does an incredible job of making you feel the challenge of climbing on a difficult wall. Whether it’s the wind pushing against you, the fatigue creeping in, or the daunting distance still left to cover, every climb feels authentic and immersive.

As for the story, it’s minimalistic but intriguing. While there isn’t a lot of direct storytelling, you’ll find letters and subtle clues scattered throughout the game that hint at a deeper narrative. It’s up to you to piece it together.

In summary, this is exactly the kind of small game I love. It’s unique, atmospheric, and worth every hour spent climbing that enormous mountain. I trully recommend giving it a try! | Wow what a beautiful experience. The artstyle is absolutely beautiful and feels so relaxing and calm.
This game felt a lot like playing Journey, The Last Guardian or Far: Lone Sails, same vibe. Feels like you’re only a companion to the main character and joining them on their lonely journey through a dead world.
I really did fall in love with this game. Immediately preordered the artbook as well, super excited.

Oh the game also feels like walking through a ghibli movie.

The gameplay is very simple and repetitive but in a very nice and relaxing way. I really enjoyed the way the climbing works.
The mechanics might be very simple but the visuals are stunning and you will encounter a lot of different biomes on your journey. Even tho there is no dialogue in the game (only text messages from past inhabitants) you could really emerge yourself in the story and the world…made me very emotional. | Solid game with cool ideas but some frustrating choices as well.  The climbing system is designed well and intuitive, but you'll definitely run into moments where it doesn't feel as crisp or responsive as you want.  The environment is beautiful, and the visual design is top notch, but you'll also get frame drops and be occasionally forced into frustrating camera angles.

Also, the autosave system is *super* frustrating.  If you're going to take a break, I'd recommend only doing it at the start of a chapter, otherwise you will always lose progress.

Overall, the pros absolutely outweigh the cons, but the cons are definitely there.  8/10

Some time ago, I realized that most movies about an alient invasion are kind of unrealistic.

If aliens really did come come here to exploit Earth for it's minerals, they wouldn't bother with the scraps of metal near the surface that we have access to - they would just slip open the Earth and harvest the nickel and iron from it's core.

This is that, the videogame, and it's awesome. | Very good game, but once you finish there's nothing to do, i'd like a rebirth system or more solar systems. I just wish there was more games like it. | Fun little game for a few hours but it hasn't been updated for one and a half years at this point and there are still many tedious issues unresolved.

People are complaining of price increase. I find this absurd. Klei is doing what I've heard of most Early Access games. Please, do not review bomb a good game, because price is increased. I do not know how game development economy works. Game is an entertainment to me and Klei is very good at their job. But, this I can tell. Most early access games have their price increased as they continue to develop. They add more contents, more mechanics and more everything. So, the price is also increased for the more everything. This is logical. This is not something to review bomb a game. Furthermore, Klei regularly communicate with their fans. I'm sure they've told you at some point that the price is going to be increased and what the new price will be. You should have bought the game then. I bought it when it still costed 5 USD. Now, it's 8 USD. When it was 5 USD, people complained about grinding. Now, I do not see people complaining about grinding. They are simply review bombing because, with improved gameplay mechanics, came improved pricing. I can't help. but laugh at people's absurdity. This is an Early Access game. So, even the price is "Early Access". If you want a cheaper game, wait for full development of the game. Once the game has sold enough copies and is old enough, you can expect a reduction in price, at least, here on Steam. Steam sells games for cheap compared to other platforms. |

Genres: Casual, Indie, Racing, Simulation, Sports, Strategy
Reviews:
For the moment, I don't see any reason to play this over Motorsport Manager or F1 Manager 2024. The game advertises as emulating the Formula 1 from the 70's (which is the selling point IMO) but rules, points, accidents and mechanical failures rate are all based on modern F1. There is not in game editor for teams, pilots and sponsors (but there is a modding guide if you want to bother. 

If you are looking for a very light F1 manager game, with minimalist but pleasant graphics and a weird dissonance between the overall ambiance of the game (the 70's) and what happens on track (modern F1), than you could get the game on a discount I guess. 

I will gladly update my recommendation to positive if we get editing tools for rules, teams, pilots, crew and sponsors in game and/or if the game actually emulates the 70's. | I love the concept of this game, as you may notice from my playtime, but I can't recommend it In its current state, as it feels more like an early access than a fully featured, balanced game. I really hope it can be improved over time through updates, which may or may not change my recommendation. | I dont like the game. After 10 min you saw everything. Afterwards its just clicking and waiting, clicking and waiting, clicking and wating..... | To be honest - I don't know what to write or exactly why I am enjoying this game, but I am. I have about 32 hours of clicking and managing my drivers around the corners to push or to relax, plus doing pit, tire and fuel strategies. 

I've read quite a lot of other reviews (positive and negative), and while I agree with even some criticism of what era of racing is being simulated, or what is left out.... this is what I was after. A sit down and manage relaxing time in front of my safe space (PC), without the need to invest too much time in understanding what parts is actually being simulated. So although this is a more relaxed take on the 'racing manager', this is exactly what I craved at the time. 

Thus I am very happy with the purchase and will continue to play untill I find I need more depth :) | This is exactly what I was looking for (TL;DR):
A fun and relaxing casual racing-manager that you can just hop into and start playing without watching any tutorial videos first. Probably wont keep you entertained for hundreds of hours but definitely worth the full price.

Some points to help you decide if this is for you:
Pros: 
-) The menus are self explanatory, everything you need is easy to find and not hidden in sub-menus. You're not ending up playing the game for hours, just to find out, that you've been missing a crucial mechanic. Micro-management is tuned down to a minimum.
-) Looks nice. Everything are pretty and clean. Buttons sound and feel satisfying - typical Funselektor stuff.
-) Instant gratification or punishment. You mess up, you know it - learn and make it better next time.
-) You can play through a season in pretty much one session. So even if you mess up the start of the season because you hired the wrong engineer or gambled too much with your sponsor - it's ok, you dont need to start the career all over again.
-) Addictive gameplay loop. Just one more race - I swear.

Neutral:
-) There are little to no helpers. When to pull your guy in for a pit stop or when to push for that crucial extra gap is pretty much up to your gut feeling (although you could theoretically figure it out yourself). I like it, but you may not.
-) There is very little RNG involved - which is positive if you hate those "BULLSH*T" moments. But on the other hands it makes the outcomes of the races very predictable and is (we are talking about racing here) totally unrealistic.
-) There are no "Are you sure?" boxes. You mindlessly click a button and figure out, you shouldn't have - deal with it.

Cons: 
-) This game is very simple - you want a deep racing-sim, look elsewhere. At least give us a fuel-strategy, it's a game about historic racing, right? Nope, you start with a full tank of gas every race and that's it.
-) Players are complaining, that the "70s F1 racing sim" is false advertising and they are correct. The only accurate 70s aspect is that drivers die - a lot.
-) The music and sound. "Art of Rally" had one of the best soundtracks I can think of and this game is just the same short boring loop and sounds. This is such a disappointment for a "Funselektor" game - probably my biggest complaint.

And nice to hear a few more regional accents. Reminded me of a house-share in Leeds a few years ago!

Looking forward to seeing what comes next from this team - more of the same would be amazing. | If you are one of those people that get weird visceral pleasure from untangling jewelry chains that are stuck together or from getting a particularly bad knot out of the drawstring of a hoodie then you'll probably like this game.

It's an alright game.

Basic borderlands looter shooter concept, but DnD themed.
Skill trees I feel are less impacting than previous iterations of the game.
You can do a dual class system which I like a lot.
The introduction of companions for most classes is cool, but I feel like they fall pretty short, even when trying to spec into them.
The weapons aren't that much different than other borderlands games. With a difference that you can different melee weapons, and a spell equipped. These are nice twists, and spells can be pretty fun with the variety of options.
The story is kind of dull to be honest. Very heavy in dialogue, which I understand it's a DnD game. But you start to tune out after a while.
The gameplay loop isn't really that exciting. The difficulty is pretty moderate with that you can clear most mobs easily, but then you have to play a little tactfully with others.

Overall I'd say it's worth a heavy discount. Definitely never worth the full asking price.
 | Bisschen lame. Fühlt sich an als würde man kaum etwas sinnvolles tun. Man spielt aber warum? Kein Plan. Ohne meinen Kumpel würde ich mich zu Tode langweilien. Wer krass auf Dnd und Shooter steht ok. Aber wer von der Qualität etwas wie BL3 erwartet wird enttäuscht. | TL;DR I would only recommend this for die-hard Borderlands fans.

The pre-endgame is exceedingly easy despite setting the difficulty to "Intense". I never struggled once up until the end game boss. The most difficult parts of earlier games were the burst damage some enemies did that was hard to overcome as a solo. While I am glad they scaled that back in this game, with no other challenge provided the core loop is reduced to holding down M1 until the enemy dies. To top it off, every quest was just "go here press E, go here shoot this, go here press E". It was a bit disappointing. 

Now admittedly this wouldn't be so egregious if there was a gripping story or moment-to-moment writing like Borderlands 2 had, but personally this game fell very flat in that regard. I listened to every dialogue line and did every side quest expecting at least some moments with the same charm as the previous games, but I didn't find any. Perhaps I have simply become jaded, but there were no hard-hitting lines nor engaging plot lines. I lightly chuckled twice the entire game. I never cringed or wondered what the writers were smoking as I did with BL3, but the Wonderlands plot was simply bland.

This isn't to say the entire game is horrible. I like much of the balance changes they made, the art style is charming, and the class system is interesting. The legendary drop rate is lowered in this game compared to BL3, which was desperately needed as they felt a dime-a-dozen in that game. This is balanced out by having your loot luck increase as you progress in the game which I felt fit very well. The new gun types, the few that aren't recycled from BL3 that is, are fun to play with and a welcome addition. And I appreciate the take on classes with a respeccable second class, although I think I still prefer the per-character system from the mainline games.

Should also be mentioned the end game is potentially the best in a Borderlands game so far: a set of repeatable trial chambers which tie closely into the "Chaos Level" system that increases enemy toughness and unlocks better tiers of gear. I have not completed all the Chaos Levels and won't pretend to have beaten each end game in all BL games, but I would like to say that this feels the most replayable and fair.

Overall a game with fun mechanics that falls entirely flat in the story department. | Some of the best Borderlands-esque gameplay outside of the main series itself. Considering this is essentially a full game inspired by the original BL2 DLC it plays like you would expect. The fantasy and magic elements help it feel unique enough to a mainline BL game. The story, writing and voice acting are all surprisingly good here, i'd go so far as to say better than some BL games. | 10/10
Great co-op game for borderlands fans, I'm really happy that they expanded on Tiny Tina's DnD adventure.

However, why are we not releasing any updates at all for this? Not saying to make it a live service game or anything but I'd like to see more content released, or at least an expansion with a raised level cap or something.

Good fun with friends for a few nights. It looks great, it plays well, has plenty of unique characters with various abilities. 

However, in the long term, this game will not hold up. There are no +500% crazy build possibilities like in Risk of Rain 2 and not enough random elements to the runs as in the Binding of Isaac to sustain numerous playthroughs. The map layout does change every time, but the points of interests on it, bosses between levels and enemies types - don't. There is not enough floating variables to make each run feel unique. Which in tern, makes you excited about new characters and abilities you get after a new run, as apposed to actually playing it. Not ideal.

Still, would recommend, since 4 player coop roguelikes are still hard to come by. | This game would be amazing if there were more map, and enemy variety. As it stands, there are only 3 maps/tile sets and 3 bosses. There are some mini-bosses, but only 2 varieties for boss caves and 2 for quests. There are only 3 quests total (1 for each map). Really wanted to love the game at 25 dollars, but they're certainly asking for more than they deserve. | Did not play a single match in our three hour session tonight where someone's client didn't crash. When you don't have the ability to rejoin a match, this is unacceptable. | 当前版本难度超标，主要体现在无脑堆怪方面。
事先声明，我是平A阿拉丁玩家，喜欢贪，一般前期都是硬币+金蛋+黑桃起手，现在卡在梦魇。
我去看了远古视频，两个点之间几乎没有什么怪物，只需要考虑清点就可以。现在野外的怪物太多，以至于甚至到了点里要处理双倍的怪物。初期好打的只有猪头人，因为会自爆。漫山遍野的食尸鬼和复读树根的大树除了卖血/耗时间以外没有速通的办法。
还有那个B钥匙，制作组是不是回家开门的时候自己家钥匙刷在了隔壁？一村boss房的白骨夫人本来半血就要锁血刷小怪，食尸鬼boss还有概率卡黑门进不去。你不打boss房没有希望钻石，打boss房找钥匙就够耽误时间。
刷新次数又要留给天赋又要留给物品bd，有的时候不胡你是真刷不出来想要的，就不能再平衡一下，然后让玩家可以自己在游戏外ban掉一部分垃圾天赋么？
以及游戏外成长几乎为0，这是我见过游戏外成长做的最垃圾的roguelike了。升级就多了些天赋，没有属性加成。然而这些天赋为了走不同bd你必须解锁，同时又掺杂了许多垃圾天赋。对于基础属性却完全没有提升，同时怪物更多更强。
不知道是不是制作组不自己玩，或者制作组都是魂5老ass踹哈人，编程爱好者。结论就是不推荐绝大部分人，你要是那种“好吃爱吃”玩家，那么请自己享受XD | Gameplay loop addictive

OK game. Basically a tower defense version of SNKRX.
While I did mildly enjoy it, it is not nearly as fun and engaging as SNKRX. It also lacks all the good music.
Gameplay is kinda clunky too. Mid- to late- game there's so many effects on the screen that it becomes difficult or directly impossible to click on your towers.

I strongly recommend SNKRX over this! If you beat it and want more, then you can consider FLERP. | Fun tower defense game. Still lacking some features but it's fun enough for what it costs. | [h2] FLERP – помесь tower-defence и автобаттлера [/h2]

Короткая игра, которая очень сильно напоминает SNKRX как в визуальном, так и в геймплейном плане (однако тут у нас tower-defence, а не арена-шутер). Ставим башенки, пытаемся выбрать самые сильные и пытаемся сочетать выставленные башенки между собой, чтобы продержаться как можно дольше.

В игре есть немного мета-прогрессии и система NG+, после каждого нового этапа лимит на доступные башни увеличивается на 1, что позволяет творить на экране ещё больший хаос. После определённого этапа забега (для моего устройства это 25 минут) на экране происходит настолько хаотичное месиво, что одна секунда игрового таймера становится равной 3 реальным секундам, происходящее превращается в слайд-шоу.

В целом игра оправдала мои ожидания, я смог приятно провести пару вечеров. Визуальный стиль приятный, удовольствие от уничтожения толп противников присутствует, а что ещё нужно?

A more relaxing game and not so funny than Two Point Hospital, this is however a very good simulation. This means that it's a pleasure to watch your minions, i.e. staff and students, going about their business and making you smile from time to time.

There are many courses you can put in your Uni and you must build a lot of rooms to make it functional. I like to build the rooms much more than in TPH because I can put more things in them, not a lot of the same posters.

For those of you not familiar with Two Point Hospital, playing this game is in fact building a University with rooms for classes, dormitories, bathrooms, places to eat and socialize, laboratories. and making sure that you are making money and make all your minions happy and serving the students enough knowledge to graduate with high honors. You can train your teachers and do research to upgrade some of your equipment.
The game is structured in missions and you have objectives to finish them from one to three stars. It's long. I've finished half of the missions in 45 hours. Not including the ones from the DLC, but playing mostly on normal speed, because I really love to watch the simulation. It makes me smile or laugh.

Pros:
- great simulation of an university
- clear and attainable objectives in mission
- relaxing and not at all frustrating (TPH has some annoying grindy moments)
- funny all over the place; the radio is hilarious and some animations too
- it's a pleasure to watch your minions doing their business in your great building af knowledge that you've build with money and sweat
- great music; actually Two Point games are almost the only ones that I play with the sound loud enough to listen what they say

Cons:
- not as funny as TPH. | 一款优秀的模拟经营类游戏，虽然是开大学，但本质还是经营数据通关。和同系列的双点医院玩法大致相同，一些亮点得到了保留，广播还是一如既往的无厘头，但有时候还挺有哲理（不是）。前期很上头，但玩到后面摸索出方法后会觉得有点疲倦，但整体还是很值得玩 | Good old Two Point county. This gets a definite Recommend from me. If I only got to say one thing, it'd be "give this a try." especially if you like Isometrics, Roguelikes, ARPGs or *Risk of Rain.*
I was surprised to see it not overwhelmingly positive so lets touch on that. 
"Runs take hours"- a player with 0.5 hours of playtime. No, No they don't. You can loop infinitely though if you choose.
"you can't save"- this is a roguelike. Your overall progress is automatically saved, and each run you start will be different and from scratch...just like every other roguelike.

Now to the obvious: Isometric Risk of Rain. Which is a GREAT thing. Yes there are differences but if that is ALL you have to go on, that is a huge win. Gameplay is smooth, all the characters are viable and can become extremely powerful, unlocking everything was a blast.
Difficulty: This seems to have people divided. There is a difficulty selector for a reason...Though I would say after unlocking everything, learning the mechanics and good builds, they could add something more challenging. 
Lastly: This is in early access! The current state is vastly different then the videos I watched to check it out 8 months ago. It will continue to develop, get content and get polished. I'm very excited to see where it goes. | Превосходная графика, хороший дизайн и интересные названия а также хороший интересный геймплей. Risk of Rain 2 is decades ahead of this game.  My kids have hundreds of hours in ROR2 and I really hoped they'd be interested in this one.  But none of us are.

As of right now, I cannot recommend this game. | This game fixes several annoyances I had with Risk of Rain 2.

Played exclusively on Steam Deck and it can usually hold 60fps but once it starts getting crazy with a lot of enemies and particle effects it will drop down to 40's or less so it definitely needs more optimization. Also one of the characters (Echo) is unplayable on controller right now but I read they already are fixing controller issues in the next big update. 

Overall, for a team of like 4 devs its a solid game with a lot of potential and I'm excited for the next update!

- Samey Gameplay
and while I do agree, I don't necessarily think it's the biggest problem due to it's lower price point. What I do think is a problem is the lack of any numbers.

When you're choosing stats, or picking up items, there's no numbers. None. What I find fun in roguelites, with perk choices and upgrades, is to make a build. With no numbers you can't really make a build. You end up guessing blindly on what is the best upgrade.

If this complaint is not immediately clear let me explain a specific scenario that happens in this game all the time; 

I want to do more dps. I just leveled up and the game gives me the choice between 3 stats to upgrade. Bullet damage, bullet attack speed, and bullet crititical chance. What do I pick to increase my dps? I literally have no idea. The game does not tell me how much crit % Im getting, how much faster my gun shoots or how much more damage I do. This in turn means that you are essentially just picking upgrades at random. I do not find this fun. | This is not like a classical roguelite game. Dome Keeper is a very fun mining simulator.
crash down on an alien planet and rush to mine out the resources below your base before enemies begin pounding at your doorstep!

this game features multiple modes, challenge levels, run modifiers, dif abilities/ chars to use, and much more!

This game has one of the most relaxing and best put together sound tracks I have heard. On a level with Terraria, Minecraft, maybe even OSRS. I am very big fan of the audio tracks, they play at just the right moments, and really helps give the game atmosphere :)

I am pretty impressed with the quality of pixel art used in the game, the creatures are all very unique aswell as the main character you play as. I am happy to see something new and exciting and this game def offers that.

I like the idea of single go runs but also like the fact they have an endless mode to just try and collect as many resources as you can in one go.

There is mod support (this is huge for me) , I am a firm believer that every game should offer mod/ workshop support. You have the freedom to continue to create assets or other things to be used in a game you very much enjoy playing. This is great for when devs cant put as much time into a project anymore or when someone has an idea to add that maybe not everyone would enjoy. Mods only support the community that plays the game and continues to support the game developer by keeping people on their game. 

Great examples of this are : Gmod, The Elder Scrolls, Spore, Fallout, Left for Dead,  etc, etc

So far I am very happy with this purchase more so than I usually would be and I hope more people give this game a chance :) | Addictive immersive fun. Terraria meets Missile Command, where the gameplay is more simple and the strategy has more depth.
 | 玩着还是比较上头，越到后面越紧张，各种挑战任务可以大大增加游戏时长，让游戏更加耐玩，非常推荐 | The mechanics of this game are simple, balance resource gathering with defence in ongoing rounds until you retrieve the relic. The genius of this game is how many different elements there are introducing variety, not to mention the fantastic visual and sound design. Обалденная игра! Пока играешь приходит расслабление, а за ним и мысли о вечном, пока соединяешь дома. Шикарно! Рекомендую. | Good game,

gets a little bit repetetive after an hour I would say, but it was definitely worth playing.

The game mechanics reminded me a little bit of Tetris but different. The goal is to combine small buildings to create even bigger buildings that can house more population (in this case the population is simply the score and has no other effect). You can see the next 4 buildings coming up - similar to the next block appearing in Tetris. However you are not under any time pressure, so you can plan ahead peacefully.

There are a few interesting twists by combining several buildings in a single turn which award you cards if you've done enough of them. In return those cards give you strong moves that would be otherwise impossible such as switching building positions for example. Without them your progress would be much more limited.

Graphics are solid, however I personally dont value graphics that much and completed the game without ever changing the standard building set. But there are several more to choose from to get some variety if you want to.

Achieved 100% after 5 hours, so the achievements are quite easy and fast to achieve. | Very satisfying tile matching gameplay. To me, it’s a mix of Bejeweled and Dorfromantik. I can see myself sinking a lot of time into this while listening to music, podcasts, audiobooks, or interviews. VR mode is a welcome and beautiful bonus. I love the art style and I’ve only unlocked 2 themes out of maybe 8-10. | I've played this loads, it's an easy game to just run in the background when you're doing things and pick it back up when you have a few minutes. Ideal for working at home and in need of a break. 

The game itself is pretty easy to learn, but takes some time to get used to, certainly if you want to get far in the game. The challenge is to really grow your cities and take advantage of the board setup. 

Nice casual game that combines "city building" with a nice laid back puzzle game. | I played the demo before release and its still such a beautiful, peaceful game. For $6 dollars (and especially while its on sale for so cheap) I could not recommend this game enough. This game is a wonderful stress killer and its visuals and music really cement that fact.

10/10

Game Name: There Is No Light: Enhanced Edition
Reviews:
I love the genre, but this game didn't delivery it in a fun and challenging way, unfortunately. I might change my review at some point, but I've given a lot of chances to this game.
The stage where worms 1-hit kill you and you have to navigate a labyrinth was what ended it for me.
The fights are really simple dodge and smash attack button all around and don't forget to dodge.
I wish there was something more to that because I don't feel good giving a thumbs down to any game, as there's so much work into making one. However, I warn the others, just like I always read reviews before buying games. | Несмотря на все достоинства очень средне. Сложно? Нет. Интересно? Ну, первую половину да, потом душниловка и убогие сайд-квесты. Вот вроде и локаций много, и боссов достаточно, все разные, и геймлпей бодрый, но все равно ни о чем. Собственно, палец вниз не ставлю только потому, что игра грамотно работает и может хоть немного доставить удовольствие. Покупать и проходить только если вы крайний любитель жанра или прям на совсем безрыбье, когда играть реально не во что. И да, проходить третий раз практически без ничего для истинной концовки? Да пошел ты н-а-х-у-й! | Hatte nicht wirklich die gelegenheit, viel über das spiel zu erfahren, da es für mich einfach nichts ist.
an sich sieht das spiel aber ziemlich gut aus und die combat mechanik ist zu anfang anspruchsvoll. Gegner waren zuerst rar aber es wurden schnell mehr. Finde das spiel gut aber ich seh mich das nicht lange spielen. | Очень достойная метроидвания от ру геймдева, впервые впечатлен подобным многообразием локаций в невероятном пиксель арте, подобном из blasphemous и Last Faith.
Что касаемо самого геймплея, он может показаться затянутым, даже слишком, поэтому следующей мотивацией играть в эту игру будет такие составляющие как:
1)интересные боевые механики
2) довольно таки частые эпические сражения с большим многообразием существ
3) отличный звук и атмосфернейшие саундтреки, да это может прозвучать банально, но что мне точно понравилось это внимание к деталям разрабов, то есть они буквально подобрали саунд под каждый айтем, поверхность и ландшафт игры, а в связи с тем, что в игре очень, я повторюсь очееень много локаций, ваши уши будут испытывать абсолютно разный и интригующий по звучанию геймплей
4)Для истинных хардкорщиков, хочу сказать, что игра далеко неказуальная, а даже очень сложная, в плане как и боссов, так и внезапных замесов с непредсказуемыми монстрами.
В целом игра показала себя очень неплохо, я бы сразу и не догадался, что она "отечественная", но это уже не важно, мне и правда было очень интересно в нее играть, надеюсь, что вскоре наши разрабы порадают нас чем-то еще. | Jogo mt massa, em resumo, é tipo um titan souls, só que com upgrades, ferramentas, história baseada em um mundo dentro de uma ferrovia ( até o momento que eu vi, com base no início ), o personagem é interessante, têm varias vilas, segredos, sistema de Karma e outros. se você gosta de pixel-art bonita então sugiro que compre imediatamente, pois diferente de jogos isométricos souls-like pixel-art, a arte deste jogo é bem feita e condiz com o esquema geral dos sprites do jogo ( isso geralmente ocorre com outros jogos indie, que tem partes em pixel-art e outras partes com efeitos diversos e não condizentes  ), enfim, é bem bonito. recomendo a compra

This game might just be one of the best sequels I’ve played. The story’s emotional rollercoaster is intense, and honestly, it’s one of the saddest journeys I’ve experienced in a game. The graphics are stunning some of the best I’ve seen. Plus, the soundtrack is incredible and really pulls you into the world. The first game did its job and set the stage for this sequel, and I would say that nearly everything was better in Requiem. The story was amazing, the graphics were stunning, and the audio design was simply excellent. The characters were well-written and the dialogue was highly entertaining, just like in the first game. Also, the voice acting in [i]A Plague Tale: Requiem[/i] was executed very well, making the game that much more engaging. And while stealth and combat weren’t the game’s strongest aspects, I feel like they were still solid enough for this game. That being said, I did encounter a few bugs and some janky gameplay—same with the first game—though these were only minor issues, and the overall gaming experience was still great.

Completing the story for the first time took me 22,5 hours. I am sure that it’s not the fastest possible time to complete the story, even for the first playthrough, but I did spend a good amount of time exploring all the hidden corners in order to acquire all the collectibles and whatnot. My total time after completing my second playthrough of the game was ~36 hours, though I did earn 100% of the Steam achievements a bit before finishing the game for the second time.

All in all, I would highly recommend [i]A Plague Tale: Requiem[/i], especially if you enjoyed the first one. And, if you haven’t played Innocence yet, I would also highly recommend that game. | I shouldn't bought this game/bundle when it was on sale. Cobalt Core carves out its own niche in the roguelike genre with a fresh approach to gameplay and mechanics. It’s a game that emphasizes strategic ship movement and the precise use of cards, creating tense and rewarding encounters that set it apart from the crowd.

The core gameplay shines with its focus on positioning and timing. Each move feels meaningful, and the balance between ship maneuvering and card usage adds a layer of strategy that keeps every run engaging. The length of each run is just right, avoiding the fatigue of overly long sessions while still offering a satisfying sense of progression.

One of the standout features is the lighthearted and charming cast of characters. Their short, meaningful conversations drive the story forward without bogging down the pace—a perfect fit for a roguelike game. The narrative elements provide just enough depth to make you care about the world and its inhabitants while keeping the focus on gameplay.

Visually, Cobalt Core is a treat. The 2D pixel art style is beautifully crafted, with vibrant colors and detailed designs that enhance the overall experience. The audio complements the visuals well, with a solid soundtrack and sound effects that add to the atmosphere without overwhelming the player.

While the game’s design is top-tier, its one notable flaw is the requirement to repeat runs to unlock additional content. This repetition can feel a bit tedious at times, especially for players who prefer more variety in their progression. However, the engaging mechanics and overall quality of the game help mitigate this issue.

Cobalt Core is a standout entry in the roguelike card game genre, offering a unique blend of strategy, charm, and polish. Its innovative mechanics, memorable characters, and beautiful presentation make it a must-play for fans of the genre. Despite some minor repetition, the game’s overall design and execution are top-notch, delivering an experience that’s as enjoyable as it is rewarding.

You are drawn cards in every X seconds intervals and the time stops while you have your cards at hand, you have mana and you build or upgrade stuff (which will be always located in the middle of the screen) and wait until it's the time for the next draw interval. The game starts out as a roguelike deckbuilder, it has it's difficulty but it's neat, both the visual and audio design in the game are pretty decent, so Heretics Fork does a good job with most of the things it's doing, except for;

End-game.
Unfortunately I cannot say the same for the late game, it's still subjective but for my sake, I would like to keep the game the way it was, in the same genre, but it fleshes out to something different the more you progress in it's meta-progression:
Basically this game has a lot of card unlocks, and in the end it allows you to equip so many different kind of winning styles, except for; "rng"
Sadly this doesn't pair well in Heretics Fork, because you are limited by only a few choices of card rewards in your entire pool, and mixed with you having way too many different card possibilities which sadly do not synergy with another, you are mostly left to the fate, essentially turning this into a casino roll, the fun and the creative aspect of the game dies with it and it becomes a "side-screen" game where you check and click based on the randomness time to time, and the most-time being spent on the "waiting" until next draw makes it even worse since your experience is no longer favored "as much" as it used to be, thanks to the crazy amount of unlocked card pool.

The game offers a lot of challenges, again, they are easier to do on low level and very difficult (rng, not actual difficulty) on late game.

It's still not a bad game per se since fun is subjective at it's best, but I wish it stayed the way it started out as, so do be warned before picking it up | Playing on Steam Deck.
